content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												 This game is more than just a bad game or a game with too many nerfs, buffs, ecenomic instability, pay to win or anything like that.... all of those are here in one way or another but hear me out, please:Mabinogi is the definition of the game that punishes you for playing it.First off, if you do have a morbid curiosity and decide to start the game, mute it. Immediately. Go into your control panel, turn down the Client.exe or Mabinogi volume through system settings, then play. If you do not do this you will be blasted with late-90's synth music that will at least make you ill, and the remaining sound effects will make you deaf.If you are still playing you will notice that you have nothing to do, and no idea what to do at all. While odds are you won't need the wiki at this point, you will need to do anywhere from 20 to 30 missions depending on the class you picked just to unlock your skills.If you manage to actually do all of these 15 minute long missions for each skill, you should just stop. Close the client, because  what you did was all you should do.You see, the game developers (at least for the north American side of the game) don't actually like it when people play the game, because their "special events" give you more experience for doing half-programed mini-games than actual dungeon crawling, which no one does because dungeon crawling is obsolete, and has been for years. How? simple: buying "gachapins" from the real-money shop can give items that are better than anything you will ever find in any dungeon. What about making the armor with blacksmiths? NOPE: event and gachapin items have better stats than anything a blacksmith can make. The newest lifeskills even? nope, new armor an weapons where released a few months later. Anything that doesn't involve throwing away real money and standing around doing nothing will just make you a second-rate character, and sometimes, you just have to sit around and do nothing, since most events reward you if you're AFK!The only thing that 90% of people do in this game is sit around town in their outfits, or try to make money by doing event mini games to make money. The few people who actually play the game typically hate what the game has become, and would play something else if they hadn't invested so much time and money in the game.Oh, did I mention that the story will make your eyes bleed? Don't read the fluff text, especially if it involves Shakespeare.TL;DR: doing nothing in this game is more rewarding than actually playing it. Do not waste your time and sanity.

number of helpful: 6 of 17 people (35%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												What can I say about this "Thrill-Ride" of a F2P game? Sorry for the ovbious sarcasm, but let's take a look at Mabinogi:This game first off immediately tries to♥♥♥♥♥♥you off by playing super-loud music at the start screen that you can't change until you've made a character. Now I know what you're thinking: There's a mute button stupid, but at the same time an experienced friend of mine is trying to teach me the basic stuff about the game. To add to that, the game is impossible to figure out unless you have a friend guiding you the whole way. Also, the game is ridiculously slow-paced and boring with just everything that you do. The combat system is ridiculously tedious and annoying to use. When you first create a character, you instantly discover you can only have one character per account and VERY limited customization options. If you try to create a male character, it will always look like a female. The pay to win system is unbelievably bad and stuff costs way too much. The resolution isn't even optimized for all screen resolutions so it looked really sluggish to me. Everything in the game looked horrible and low-res. There is tremendous lag on every server and channel even though I have way above the recommended system specs for this game. The worst part is, the customer support for the game by the publishers, Nexon, are unresponsive and couldn't care less for the community. The servers are practically barren and the few people I find outside of the 2 friends that tried to guide me through the game never leave me alone and spam the chat like crazy. The first guy you meet, Duncan literally tells you that: "All of these jobs may seem boring to you." So heed his warning. The only things that are nice about this game is that it is a bit different from other mmos and the story is set up well. But other than that, this feels like a boring, tedious, annoying, and a confusing experience the whole way through. This game is slowly dying so I advise not to get in to it. The sad thing is, I hear from lots of dedicated players that the game was decent when it first came out back in 2003, but then Nexon screwed it up significantly. The worst part is, there are way better Free-To-Play MMOs like Planetside 2, Warframe, SWTOR, Rusty Hearts, Cosmic Break, and so on. This game was so bad that my testicles committed suicide due to the lack of testosterone considering that no matter what you do to customize your character, you'll always look like a female! Not being sexist or anything, but I want to look like my own gender please, come on now Nexon!To sum it up, this isn't just a bad F2P MMO, it's probably one of the worst F2P MMOs I've ever played. Just do yourself a favor and just play a different F2P game unless you enjoy grinding for several hours just to earn or do anything that is cool or fun at all.P.S. This game killed my son and I became an alcoholic thanks to this game.

number of helpful: 7 of 19 people (37%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2012
												A good MMO if you don't want do battle. The battle system sucks and is frustrating as hell, however the music system is original and good, it allows you to put any song you want into the game, if you know how.On the music system there is a lot to offer, ranging from different instruments to creating your own music score, solo or band optimized.The music system is the largest pull of the game, and is certainly what got me to get the game and stay in it for longer than I care to admit.Be wary of the "free" grab as well, everything is free except quite a lot of the game, which can be frustrating because to have more than one character, you have to buy, to have your character look unique, you have to buy.However it has addicting game play and interesting NON-combat orientated systems, but the moment you get into the combat, you're greeted by a poorly designed system, that not only makes it boring to fight, but painful, on that note the combat side feels ignored, the drop rate ratios are far from decent, and the dice roll based damages, can be quite unforgiving for new players, or Australian players, as there are no Australian servers which makes latency, a royal pain in the left butt cheek.This game gets a 4/10 from me.

number of helpful: 3 of 11 people (27%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Okay, I'll give a serious review of this game now.I've wasted about $7000 dollars and 9 years of my life playing this game, and in the end if you asked me if it was worth it, I'd say hell no.This game has an inferior game engine that has been used like a beaten horse since 2006. There are no scheduled plans for this game's engine to get the update it so desperately needs, and because of this, the game suffers extreme lag day in and day out.The community of this game is toxic as all hell, not as toxic as say, League of Legends, but pretty ♥♥♥♥in' bad.The game's systems are outdated, and while I will say this: I have enjoyed several aspects of the game, from the fast-paced, skill-based combat, to the fact that you can use a programming language (MML: Musical Markup Language) to literally creat your own pieces of music; the game is severely lacking in other aspects, such as proper guild-managment systems and end-game content. Recently, you might say, they added a new dungeon that is consider end game, but that is only accessable through months of grinding to get to a minimum level of 3000, and that's not the hardest variation of said dungeon, which, to reach, you need to have a minimum level of 7000, and good luck finding someone to help you out with that.Speaking of which, something the community has asked for time and again is the server merge the game so desperately needs, as whenever I do log on, I see maybe 5-6 people on my friendslist of 300 people actually online.And you might be also asking, but Gil, what's that $7000 up there about? Well, I'm glad you asked, because instead of offering meaning and worthwhile content, the devs of this game would rather♥♥♥♥♥♥out the ugliest, worthless and most useless piles of♥♥♥♥♥♥items through their "Gachapon" systems that they try so hard to grab your hard-earned money with almost every 2 weeks when they put them up for sale. I have attained a literal gambling addiction, from spending so much money trying to get the stupidest ♥♥♥♥ing things in these last 9 years, and I've accrued so much debt that I now require to sell some stuff to make up for the debt of all the money I wasted throughout the years.I will say this to everyone, and everytime I'm asked if this is a good game to play, my answer will always be the same: NO. DO. NOT. PLAY. THIS. GAME. IT. IS. A. WASTE. OF. TIME. MONEY. AND. EFFORT.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												Stay away from it while you can.~Axelrod of AlexinaIf you want an explanation, literally all of the hours that I've put into this game have gone into AFKing. If there was a point where I wasn't AFK, it was because I was talking to friends. Why nothing else?Your input is delayed if you don't adjust your network settings, the game's so unoptimized that the font they use is even capable of causing frame skips, and any new content they have have gets stuffed into a gachapon.What's a gachapon?A gachapon is a form of gambling that is legal for people of any age if you do it in Mabinogi, as long as you convert your real money into a fake currency they call NX and spend your NX on these boxes that are more likely to have garbage inside of them than what's advertised. And the people who localize this game even embrace gachapons enough to make them into a Steam emoticon.So I'll re-emphasize my point. Stay away from this game while you can. This review update was brought to you by a bored Axelrod on 3/28/2016.

content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
												Mabinogi. When i found this on a top ten list of anime mmo's, i got rather excited, and couldnt wait to play the game. From what ive seen, its really good! trailer is cool, showing what looks like a robust open world to live in , rather than play in. Un fortunatly, thats where to good stuff ends. After a one hour download for the files (3.8gb) in steam (not much, but wait. there's more), i went to play the game, thinking it should be fine, it's downloaded. 27 HOURS later, the 3.9gb patch FINALLY finished downloading (why take so long? *shrug*). Ok, so long downloads are nothing new. lets play. Iplay for 5min, looking awesome... then crash. 900mb update. ok, still going, still wanting to play the game. play again. Get to login screen and.... crash. enexplained, just an unhelpfull error message. fine. i give up. ill spend my time with simething else. good day.

number of helpful: 3 of 13 people (23%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												I agree with StalkingEmu this game is also bad beacause one of it's main ways to draw players in using a sexual fanbase. Just look at the woman on the cover, COME ON REALLY!*THIS IS HIS REVIEW*What can I say about this "Thrill-Ride" of a F2P game? Sorry for the ovbious sarcasm, but let's take a look at Mabinogi:This game first off immediately tries to ♥♥♥♥ you off by playing super-loud music at the start screen that you can't change until you've made a character. Now I know what you're thinking: There's a mute button stupid, but at the same time an experienced friend of mine is trying to teach me the basic stuff about the game. To add to that, the game is impossible to figure out unless you have a friend guiding you the whole way. Also, the game is ridiculously slow-paced and boring with just everything that you do. The combat system is ridiculously tedious and annoying to use. When you first create a character, you instantly discover you can only have one character per account and VERY limited customization options. If you try to create a male character, it will always look like a female. The pay to win system is unbelievably bad and stuff costs way too much. The resolution isn't even optimized for all screen resolutions so it looked really sluggish to me. Everything in the game looked horrible and low-res. There is tremendous lag on every server and channel even though I have way above the recommended system specs for this game. The worst part is, the customer support for the game by the publishers, Nexon, are unresponsive and couldn't care less for the community. The servers are practically barren and the few people I find outside of the 2 friends that tried to guide me through the game never leave me alone and spam the chat like crazy. The first guy you meet, Duncan literally tells you that: "All of these jobs may seem boring to you." So heed his warning. The only things that are nice about this game is that it is a bit different from other mmos and the story is set up well. But other than that, this feels like a boring, tedious, annoying, and a confusing experience the whole way through. This game is slowly dying so I advise not to get in to it. The sad thing is, I hear from lots of dedicated players that the game was decent when it first came out back in 2003, but then Nexon screwed it up significantly. The worst part is, there are way better Free-To-Play MMOs like Planetside 2, Warframe, SWTOR, Rusty Hearts, Cosmic Break, and so on. This game was so bad that my testicles committed suicide due to the lack of testosterone considering that no matter what you do to customize your character, you'll always look like a female! Not being sexist or anything, but I want to look like my own gender please, come on now Nexon!To sum it up, this isn't just a bad F2P MMO, it's probably one of the worst F2P MMOs I've ever played. Just do yourself a favor and just play a different F2P game unless you enjoy grinding for several hours just to earn or do anything that is cool or fun at all.P.S. This game killed my son!

It's been dead for like 7 years... let it be.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												I've spent almost two years on this game, and I've gotta say, I'm still sticking around.It's a unique game. Everything can be obtained, and there really is no true p2w. I guess it'd be p2getitemseasier.It's skill and leveling system is different compared to other games. There is no true level cap, and as long as you rebirth, you can keep on restarting from level 1 and getting AP all over again. There are no classes you choose. Simply equip the weapon you want to use, and have the skill. Weapons are unique as well. There are no "Level 50 Behemoth Sword". all weapons can be used from the get-go, excluding racial restrictions.Verdict: It's fun. Try it out if you think you might like it, and if you think you won't, still, try it out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												Quite possibly one of the most annoying games I have ever played. Getting past the passwords for Nexon and Mabinogi popup and hotscreen to even play are ridiculous and getting your first skill is beyond annoying. I chose archer and the targeting system has you pressing multiple keys and resetting multiple times for each attack which is stupid. You dont get much of a character choice or pet choice unless you pay for facial expressions and get "tickets" for all the other extras. So for such a dinky little game with awkward controls and lousy targeting system it isnt worth a penny of my money. Glad this was a free to play or I would be upset.

												A fantastic game run by a 'meh' company. The game is great, there's plenty of content so you'll rarely be stuck with nothing to do. To add to that, this game focuses on the idea of a 'fantasy life', so you're not just forced into fighting monsters all day long. There's a lot of different things to do, and it's up to you to decide what your personal goals are. The biggest problem with the game is that it isn't very beginner friendly, even after a few attempts to make the game easier for beginners. You'll probably want help from someone who plays the game avidly to help you get a good idea of how things work out. The main thing to remember is that this is a game, so just enjoy yourself. Everyone who plays this game wants to have a nice fantasy life, so try not to ruin it for them and they shouldn't try to ruin it for you, either.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												To make this fairly simple for those who want to know if this game is worth playing, i say yes...however thats simply not enough to be said about this game, because for all the time ive played video games and what ive labled as a "bad" game this game has... 1.poor visuals: this games graphics are very simple and... like most games that try to do the anime style onto a 3D modle it translates oddly.2. it is buggy as ♥♥♥♥... you see monsters stuck on themselves ALL the time.3. you gotta pay into it to get the most outta it.so by those factors alone, one would think... why waste the time then? Well my inquisative gamers ill tell you why, its been the best experiance i have had with a "fantasy-life" MMO, its strange sounding, especially with the afformentioned problems.the possiblity of customization is insane and the open class system is well done, want to be a knight? well congrates get a lance and you learn the basic knight skills. want to be a mage? well thats covered, want to be a druid that transforms into animals like WoW? well guess what thats in there too.  (not to mention you have a crap ton of things to turn into, from a useless chicken, to a dragon, to one of you favorite NPC's) the games subtle details are very nice like food affecting your weight, ageing and getting taller, your charector looks at a player after they type things in. and the sence of acheivemnt is pretty good in this game, making a weapon for the first time felt REALLY awesome because it was a lagitamently difficult.To make a pretty broad statement about this game this game looks like crap, smells like crap , but tastes like paradise,and im almost certain if nexon did a mabinogi 2, with cell shading, voice actors, and stomped out the stupid bugs... you would be looking at the next greatest MMO

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												I am going to try and write an endepth and fair review for this game including what i love and what i hate. ill break it down into 3 catagories 1.The Good 2. The bad and 3. The Ugly        So lets start with the good. mabinogi is a f2p game that does not treat you like a second class citizen when you play it. you can earn alot of things most games would make you pay for from either other players or just hard work. The community is also very nice unlike world of warcraft or other mmos ive played. most people i have met are kind and friendly and love to help new players out. A majority of the community seems like weeaboos but hey they are nice weeaboos. The combat system is very unique and is adaptable to almost any play style although some skills are just straight up better than others. almost every class is viable and if you are not happy with your class you can swap it in 3 weeks or 1 day if you are under level 100.          The bad. This mmo used to be predatory. very pay to win and there are alot of things from the past that come to haunt you. for example the generation quests. in order to beat the final boss of Generation 3 you will NEED someone who is about level 1000 or higher to help you beacuse it is a gaint dragon who does massive aoe 4000 damage attacks.  (at this point you will have about 150 heatlh). there are still a few pay to win elements for exampe you could buy a cloud that will heal you when you summon it. sounds alright right? well what if you buy 4 of them? you got a chain of full health aoe heals for the low low price of 60 dollars. Want the best upgrade for your weapon? be prepared to grind for hundreds of hours to repair it or just pay 5$.           Another thing is the economy. Do you wanna study how inflation works in an economy run by 15 year olds? well mabinogi is a great case study. anything remotley nice costs about 200000 to 500000 gold so once again do you wanna grind for hours and hours or do you wanna just buy expensive items from the store and sell them to players? although  I need to preface my gripes about pay to win by saying it is getting better. in fact it already is better in korea and we just gotta hope they keep updating the american version. you can not just grind levels infinetly beacuse the game has a system called rebirthing. rebirthing sets your level back to 1 but lets you keep all your skills. if you do not rebirth once you hit level 50 or so it becomes very very hard to level up and you have to wait 3 weeks to rebirth again. just another annoying progress blockerThe ugly. The art style is ALL OVER THE PLACE. very much influenced by korean culture even though the game is set in a mythical european setting. immersion breaking does not even begin to describe the cosmetics in this game. it is worse than tf2. You play as a bunch of immortal demigods so i guess it makes sense that they copy clothes from earth but still it makes no damn sense. I have alot more to say about the game but im sick of typing so ill wrap it up. The game is fun VERY FRUSTRATING. but fun and hey it is free just be sure to read up♥♥♥♥♥♥on the wiki and make friends and you will have a good time. Do not buy the starter packs on steam they are worthless garbage learn the game before you make any purchases (I apologize for the grammar and spelling mistakes i am to damn lazy to go through and spell check this.)

												    Community is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ now most guilds require rediculously high total levels with two alternatives which happen to be new guilds (which usually die given a few weeks) or guilds with so much drama involved you'll be wanting to leave in a matter of hours. The skill systems suck now. When I first started playing mabinogi years ago the skill system was perfect the enemy AI was actually intelligent and made the game difficult which was FANTASTIC. With the addition and revamping of so many skills and now getting AP for talents it makes the game hilariously easy.   Sure hope you like spending money! Because if you like to save your money, back the ♥♥♥♥ away now! This game is pay to win and I should know as I've spent more than my fair share of money on this bucket of crap. Pets are basically useless now. Before it was difficult to beat the game without some kind of pet because the difficulty curve actually existed. Now Nexon is coming out with pets worth $12 that ♥♥♥♥ing SING ALONG WITH YOU.   Sure hope you don't like customer service when it comes to nexon. One of my accounts was banned years back for no particular reason and I sent a ticket in and I never heard a damn thing about why my account was banned. So within a span of about 3-4 years I sent in a total number of 15 tickets and NONE of them had even been touched by the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cutomer "service" representatives. There are also absolutely NO refunds here. Trust me I did try to get my money back from wasting at least $200 on my at the time recently banned account.  The events are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and are recycled every year. You're lucky if you happen to see an event from a few years back and that's what they say is "New and shiny events" more like trash that they shined up for you so they could stick it up your♥♥♥♥♥easier. On occasion they'll add a new event but generally it's so boring you'll wish there were no events. Mabinogi makes it now so that there is ALWAYS an event but it just...It just doesn't work.All in all the game just isn't all that fun anymore. I certainly would not recommend it anymore.

												I have played mabi from the first generation and on and off for every year, sometimes doing speed runs on different characters. It's not the same as the older versions but it's still good. The client is low spec so you can multitask while playing and the gameplay is reactive and somewhat player skill based early on but at higher levels it might not be as fun. The best part of this mmo is the character customization. In the past I delete all my characters to start over with all the  customization features for free, but I don't know if that works anymore. It's a good mmo to create a character you like and play with.

Posted: August 27, 2014
												Its impossible for me not to reccomend mabinogi. Ive been playing the game 0ff-steam for years and ive fallen in love with it over and over again. The game has tons of new features, and even though its old, Nexon keeps it well updated. The Best thing about mabinogi is the community. Nearly everyone is always cheerful and will be kind to you under almost any circumstance. Coming into the game and making a new friend is an amazing feeling because Mabinogi lets you do so much together and really wouldnt be the same alone. It has a unique blend of strategy and real time combat that makes it wonderful in its own little way, along with hundreds of moves and so many ways to keep an enemy off your tail (yes, you can have a tail if you want).Even hardcore gamers would find there own little guilty pleasure in leveling up and getting stronger. The game was updated a while back so now noobs can easily find a foothold in the world of erinn, plus with the game being free, theres really no reason not to give it a try. Theres no limits in this game as to what you want to do and even after playing for so long im still surprised by what i see. So come and send me a friend request. My name is dumgrum nice to meet you. (join tarlach server its the best)

												This game is fairly awesome, theres been lots of changes since ive started i dont agree with tho that removes the necessity for a few pets but then again, i am an elitest on this game lol, i will admit this game is 100% free to play but... i have dropped over $5000 admititdly just for a large amount of gachapons mainly but also side stuff like self ressurection and reforges, it seems stupid to many people but ive played around 700 hours w/o payign a single dime...  as a single guy with a job and only house bills to pay, i got the money for it :) and honestly is worth every penny imo.The ranking system and social value is pretty high up there tho the only negative thing about the game is that its getting really really easy which i dont see why (other then to accomidate the younger and lazyer generation) i want to see this game move foward with harder dungeons and more expansive content, i dont see why bother to have every map preloaded instead of constant small area rendering, which would correct alot of gltiches (primarily some commerce bugs), save alot of lag and make the game seem more worldy? adventruable? some word like that.I'd love the game even more if they can make it happen with maybe possiable world pvp server or option, as the current "world pvp" is rather lame but admidly fun in cities sometimes, i feel theres alot of potential for pvp mini-games and ranking and lots of other stuff as well.Three cheers for the militents and humans that put thier effrort in this game tho!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 11, 2013
												Mabinogi is a very drab game. It advertises endless possibilities and mountains of content, when in reality the only real things you can do involve trading and stabbing bears. The combat is too lopsided, the story is too KAWAII-DESUUUUUU~ and the economy is a huge mess. Dungeons are boasted as in-depth and randomly generated, which they are (kinda). Small enemies can kill you just as quickly as you can kill them, and bosses require a couple of players (or luck, in most cases) to beat, which kills it for me because I like being able to solo most things. Armor does nothing, surprisingly, and you're better off saving your money up for weapons and potions than splurging on armor. There's also a wound system that requires you to use bandages before potions do any good, forcing you to waste even more time. Everything is a grind and nothing is rewarding. Good luck getting anything done. Trust me, you'll need it.

content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
												Honestly the best MMO i've ever played despite its age. I put and invested countless hours into this game off steam (which shows in the lack of hours.) The number one reason why this game isn't as famous as it should be is because it's simply owned by Nexon. The company has ruined many popular titles such as MapleStory, Dungeon Fighter Online, and yes that includes Mabinogi. All games are still popular in korea, but due to the INSANE price differences in the Korea version VS. the NA version cash shops, this MMO constantly has you spending 3x-4x more than an average Korean player. If this game was owned by another company such as Riot Games, or another known good company with a good sense of customer relations, this would easily topple the gaming industry in terms of Fantasy MMOs. Highly recommend if you're going to spend thousands of dollars on this "f2p" mmo to try and buy Final Fantasy 14 Online. Yes its subscription, but in the end its a lot cheaper than Nexon's "f2p" mmos.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												This game seems clunky and weird at first. It's hard to really get into any mmo, the first time you try it after finding one you enjoy, but Mabinogi has an... aura to it. It has this unique feeling. I've found no other game like this to a T, as you can with many other MMORPG's. I was horribly depressed. This game gave me new life as I found new friends, went on new adventures and found.. a strange living comfort in my new found fantasy life. But now, mabinogi is not what it used to be. It's okay, it's still great by all means, how ever... I can no longer recommend it with every fiber of my being. I say try it. Try it, and see what you can find that is for you. It's your fantasy life. So it's up to you, to find your own joys, your own story, your own friends, your own likes, your own dislikes. This is a game made for YOU, the player. It's a bit pay2win, but none of it is mandatory for certain things. Pay2get pets can come out in certain events, some items can be found in the market for a hefty price either way and if you wait it goes down. It's a good game. It just.. takes a specific type of person to love it. So enjoy it, if you can. If you don't, fret not. There are other games more suited for you. But I myself love mabinogi. I would say, by all means, give it a try. Sure, some sour spots can be found here and there, but honestly, I say go for it. If you DO play, try mari server first. Fact; Alexina is a bad server. It has the worst type of players on it.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2015
												I'd say this game has lived quite past its glorious day, but most of its features can be interesting.Firsthand, the crafting system feels a bit more involved, for you actually have to toss-in inputs in order to gain improved results, which is quite an interesting twist on the standard MMORPG's way of rolling with that.The combat system feels a bit awkward at first, but that issue will eventually disappear with time.The main issue I can perceive so far is related to the low server population, but it is quite normal at this advanced stage of existence.Lastly, if you enjoy life skills and some creative class design, this game has plenty of them to entertain you for quite a while.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 6, 2015
												I've only just started playing this game but thus far I really like it. A lot of the people playing are pretty friendly as long as you aren't rude and the game is pretty easy to figure out when you get in. The first thing I would want to say though is that going into this I did make 2 characters, one of them was used for learning to play the game, and the other was used to play once I figured the game out. idk if this was a good Idea but I feel like with the first character I was able to make all the mistakes I needed to make while learning and not worry about it affecting the rest of my gameplay experience.That being said it didn't take me long to figure the game out and if you're used to most basic MMO style gameplay then you should be able to figure out a lot of the concepts and UI placement pretty quickly. When I started I played as a basic human warrior and I have to say that I had a lot of fun with the combat. The fighting style with close combat is very fun and it feels like when you're hitting things you're actually doing something. The second talent I tried was magic because I thought it might be kinda fun to use magic at a distance and then beat my enemies down with my sword when they got close. I do have to say that to me personally I didn't think that the magic felt very rewarding to me. It seemed like I was just kinda poking things and making them angry and I found myself using my swords a lot more often.Another thing I noticed that I actually really liked is that you can go anywhere. If you want to wander into an area with mobs that are much stronger than you, the game won't tell you that you can't. I mean you will obviously get murdered going in there but I feel like it makes the game more fun when exploring because you don't know how powerful a mob is compared to you in a new area until you attack it. The sense of exploration and not knowing if you'll get your♥♥♥♥♥handed to you the second you attack something makes the game a lot more fun for me personally.Again this is all low level beginner experiences of mine and the gameplay could become much better as you become higher level. I feel that this game is probably going to become kind of an addiction for me but this is also the first 2 weeks of me playing this game. I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys MMO style games and loves exploration in games.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												If you're looking for a fantasy life game that isn't the sims, play this first. This game is really fun with friends. Get friends, play with them. I've been playing on and off since I was about 10 or 11. I am now 16, still fun but the game has changed more than I would have liked it to. The social aspect is really awesome, the game isn't really suit for pvp unless you're dueling or have your trans pvp activated. One of the only things I don't like about it now is how it seems that it is beginning to die out of players, Alexina still says "new server" even though it came out before I even started playing, Nexon made it incredibly easier for new players to get a hold of the game if they're under level 1k (now new people wont know the struggle of having to wait for weeks just to rebirth). Other than the nostalgia of being a kid that it gives me, I have to say it is indeed one of the best MMO games I've ever played since it hits the dot when it says "fantasy life."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
												Fairly large learning curve. I put most of my time into it from Nexons website, but logged quite a few hours on here as well.If anything it had one of the best communities of any game I had ever played. With tons of classes and quite a few people to talk to. Literally spent my first week playing just screwing around in town with people having a good time. Its a pretty relaxed game, or at least it was.Right now its mostly just people hanging out in town and showing off their cash shop items, chatting, and maybe dueling. Which is OK, but no one runs dungeons anymore, most just buy stuff from the cash shop. Its kind of hard to recommend playing since the community pretty much stopped doing any form of dungeons etc unless you get to the much higher levels of play where people are constantly doing dailys etc. Its also gotten quite a bit taken over by a lot of kids bregging about cash shop items and not doing anything else.Other then those few issues however, I have had more fun on this game than any other MMO I have ever played and Nexon fixed a few quality of life issues even though the game doesn't run all that great. One of which is their rebirth system in which you reset your level down to 1, but retain all your ability points (used to level up whatever you feel like training at the time: cooking, fishing, warrior, archer, cook, tailor, lots of things.) Rebirthing helps you level up and get the ability points fast again, and now free players can do this much more often. Once a week I believe which is usually pretty perfect.One of the best parts about the game however is that you can pretty much play however you want. I was exploring the desert for a few days, mastered some cooking, then killed some beasties in a few dungeons. Its pretty crazy what you can screw around with, and even though the community went a bit downhill, its still really good; especially compared to many other MMO's out there.If you are looking for a fairly relaxed game with tons of options and a pretty cool community, and don't mind the constant spam of people playing clannad/sword art music. Then download this and get to chatting and dungeon crawling. Its a lot of fun when you get some people to hang out with.Sorry if this review is a bit jumbled up, not a lot of time and its my first one. Best of luck in the world of Mabinogi!

content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												This game is pretty great. The graphics are out-dated, but the community is good and generally helpful. There is no P2W concept, you can buy pets which can help you carry loot and junk, but they aren't going to win any battles for you. The learning curve is there and noticeable, but once you get a grasp of the game it's easy to work with. It's an overall fun game, and has loads of potential and variety for you to look into. But some patience might be required, and having and making friends to play with will certainly make the experience more fun. The story is also great and in-depth and all the characters you meet have some fleshy story to them.All in all I would rate this game a strong 8/10,  if it had better graphics and more streamlined combat like say Tera or something then I would say this is probably the closest to a perfect MMO you'll find.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
												After 3000+ hours, I should be recommending Mabinogi to other players or those who are interested in it. However it may be, feel free if you want to spend time on the game because after all it's a one-of-the-kind MMO's and nothing really compared to it at the time. Though if you are wondering why I don't recommend it......it's because it's now lost many of the great qualities of what made this game most enjoyable.After all these years of playing, I can now say I wouldn't recommend it due to several changes.For veterans and newcomers alike, you'll understand that this game can be punishing, gameplay wise and economically wise. Learning how to play was a little difficult. When we got used to it, there was more to it and that was the fun part. Making those mistakes but learning from them and getting better and better. It's now spoonfed to you in the early levels when it comes to exploring and developing your character. Grinding is still the same as it is back then only the hard part is the later levels.When it gets too tough for, that's where microtransactions come in. They are literally the game changers including what you can get from exclusive events. That also means the economy has a massive overhaul due to the ease of obtaining the items.Over the past years I played it on and off. When I played it, I would literally spend so much time on this and when I took a break it would be about one or two months. I enjoyed playing music scores made by other players, jamming to those songs, questing with randoms and just chilling in Dunbarton with random players. The community was great. The keyword is "was".You still have great people and those who help out but now it's taken over by a lot of terrible players in terms of verbal abusers, scammers, hackers and griefers usually as a wolf in sheep's clothing. It's also come to the point where power balancing is ridiculous. One class that started out as mediocre becomes the strongest thing in the game and then gets screwed over again as the cycle repeats.Not only these issues aside, nowadays Nexon's recently gotten lacklustre with their customer support. I've noticed this in other games because for example 'Maplestory' they had banned a majority of players due to being exposed to a hacker and there was no way to get back your account at all. If you saw a hacker in Mabinogi or someone who was literally abusing the system and everyone else, they don't care. As long as they continue to get money for their ridiculously overpriced things then there's no support for you.In honesty, I enjoyed the game a lot and I do want to recommend it but it's become more difficult to and I don't plan on returning to Mabinogi with all my time spent there. It's bittersweet at best.If you do have the time (or/and money) to spend on this game and want to invest in this game because you are interested, I won't stop you. If you don't because of what I had mentioned or you simply don't have the time then I suggest looking elsewhere.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												If you're looking for a fantasy life game that isn't the sims, play this first. This game is really fun with friends. Get friends, play with them. I've been playing on and off since I was about 10 or 11. I am now 16, still fun but the game has changed more than I would have liked it to. The social aspect is really awesome, the game isn't really suit for pvp unless you're dueling or have your trans pvp activated. One of the only things I don't like about it now is how it seems that it is beginning to die out of players, Alexina still says "new server" even though it came out before I even started playing, Nexon made it incredibly easier for new players to get a hold of the game if they're under level 1k (now new people wont know the struggle of having to wait for weeks just to rebirth). Other than the nostalgia of being a kid that it gives me, I have to say it is indeed one of the best MMO games I've ever played since it hits the dot when it says "fantasy life."

												I'd say this game has lived quite past its glorious day, but most of its features can be interesting.Firsthand, the crafting system feels a bit more involved, for you actually have to toss-in inputs in order to gain improved results, which is quite an interesting twist on the standard MMORPG's way of rolling with that.The combat system feels a bit awkward at first, but that issue will eventually disappear with time.The main issue I can perceive so far is related to the low server population, but it is quite normal at this advanced stage of existence.Lastly, if you enjoy life skills and some creative class design, this game has plenty of them to entertain you for quite a while.

Posted: April 21, 2015
												This game has got me coming back over and over again, not only because it's a good MMO, but the friends that you make and the relationships you build through the impressive social community are outstanding. If you only played this game for the dungeons and etc, you're missing out on quite a bit. The character customization isn't the best, but they make up for it in gear. The game itself has a anime style touch to it and even had a Sword Art Online event at one point (Which I have Kirito's outfit, swords, and wings now ^.^). I think out of anything in this game, my favorite aspect is their music playing. You can play an instrument and even write your own music (if you know how to do it with MML). If you ever want to try out a game that has a nice social aspect aswell as combat, try out Mabinogi. Mabinogi is best played with friends or friends made along the way <3Although it says I've only played 0.2 hours. I have played much longer than that off of steam.

number of helpful: No ratings yet1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fabulous and bad at the same time. If there was a neutral button toward a review, this would be the one game I'd use it on. Here are some pro's & con's.Con's first, cause' it will grab your attention at the very finest.PS: , I mention this later but, I have around 2500 hours on this game and I've played for four years. Don't take my hours on the steam platform for granted please :)Cons:*BAD support, as far as I know, only half the people in their customer/tech support system actually do their job.*Money-hungry company, this game is 'considered' a pay to win due to the mere impossibility of doing things without money near-end game, but it's still a great experience otherwise.*Not much customization, in outfits, near early-game, which is rather considerably okay how they deal with it. Not really a con.//Some of these con's deal with the company that franchises it, the gameplay is, heavily, HEAVILY, different.Pros:*Epic combinations of skills that will leave you on your seat when you happen to get that unexpected boss kill ;D*Best community out there for a [mainly] free2play game.*Grand amounts of customization near mid-game, leading to epic skill combos, neat outfits, tools..*DUAL WIELDING, do I HAVE to explain this? They handle it so well.*It doesn't feel like a grind in the beginning or middle, near late game is where grindy stuff happens.*Memorable times...!*A VARIETY of amazing skills such as fishing, making a campfire, cooking even! These were added to make the game more realistic and overall bondworthy toward. It also makes some killer picnic's.*Realistic-like PVP , or, in this case, Duels. You literally walk up to someone, ask them if they want to duel. A menu comes up, you set the pre-requisites straight forward and get dueling. You aren't FORCED to do it either, and you can make good friends off of it.*Graphics are easy to render, a lower-end / mid-end computer could easily run 30-100FPS. The game was made around 2000-something if I recall. The graphics still look amazing though.//*Death penalty system is not degradeful, hated, or anything in particular. It is annoying when you die, you get Nao stones to revive on full health sometimes though, and even if you do die, you don't lose anything. There is a chance when you die you may lose your gear if its expensive and not blessed by a certain item, but you can get it back at a town hall for a .. 'reasonable yet sometimes a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ kind of price.//*And finally, its NOT a rage game. Well, not easily alas. Sometimes there are mobs that can truly p1ss off someone but other than that, you don't lose very much.//\\Oh and, don't take my hours for granted. This game was just recently platformed on steam, it used to be on the companies website, which doesn't, as you may know, transfer hours over to here.I've played Mabinogi for four years! Highly inactive, but I at least have 2500 hours on the game and I've witnessed all the stuff they've done on it.//\\This is a more TL:DR Version::!!//\\There are plenty more cons to the game, but they are outweighed heavily by the amount of pros this game contains. The community is so well knitted together that even a child could have fun without any pervs or foul language to watch out for. It's fun, engaging, and most of all, it's made for a community. You can manage epic combos in combat, you can even have pets. Its pretty cool, and is definitely worth trying.However, the support service/s are typically bad, but you can still manage a refund if you didn't get something you payed for. They are money hungry , as they support many different games imported from Japan, and I can understand that. When they ask for too much money though, its pretty noticable. Back on the topic of the game though, there isn't much customization in the beginning, so its kind of boring. If you keep on going though, you'll find it pretty epic overall.--//...An even more TL;DR version..!! ;//\\Fun / Engaging game; but has a bad support service / company. It is a near pay to win at the end, but it is still very fun. It's also very involved with the community, most people are friendly and you don't have to watch out for swear-a-holics. A 9 year old could play this and learn to be kind from the community, most of the time.//OVERALL SCORE, the moment you've been waiting for..I give this game an 8.5 / 10  !!The reason I knocked off 1.5 points was rather simple, just the bad service and company it is owned by in America and the 'noticable yet not overkill' hunger for money they desire to keep the game rolling. Here is a more in-depth explanation.+1 - Great graphic design, even for a game made near 2000. It can also handle lower-end computers well.+3 - Epic community for a free-to-play game, it is very well knitted together, its hard to rip apart. Very hard.+4.5 - Amazing combat system, PVP, and gameplay in general. Has a killer storyline too.-1.5 - Aside from all that, the game has a bad support system and is a mere pay to win near the end. You can still have a great time though.Thanks for reading through this, I hope I've told you the most I could about this fabulous game.-~Kon

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												I have played Mabinogi on and off for years, yet it still is always able to draw me back into the game sometime down the road with new interesting content. Although I have only played 200ish hours on steam, I have played since before the release of "Pioneers of Iria" (appx. late 2008 - early '09). The Pros: - many many skills - no specific class restrictions ( you can be a dual-sword-wielding, fireball-ing, gunslinging, musical chef if you want ) - most items can be dyed to what colors you wish - Most, if not all, storylines have been streamlined - Addition of Talents, which are like titles for how proficient you are in certain skill sets (i.e. combat, magic, music etc.) - The Saga storylines give your character a chance to be a part of "episodes", like a tv series. - Continually seems to come out with events / updatesThe Cons: - Pets are extremely hard to get these days without paying cash - In some areas, on some channels, the LAG IS REAL. - Cash shop items are EXPENSIVE. For example, buying a 15,000 Nx pet? That will be $15 US. - The economy of gold seems to be rather pricy on certain, desirable items. ( 20 million+ gold for a set of "eh" wings ) - Dyes are expensive. Overall, I'd recommend Mabinogi with a 8.75/10. There are some issues, but aren't there issues with every mmo out there? And although this game is "old" ( 2006 release ), it's still alive and kicking.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Among all of the MMOs and online multiplayer games I have played over the years, Mabinogi is truly a one of a kind game. Originally debuted in 2004 as a pay 2 play and transitioned to a free 2 play in closed beta, Mabinogi started off small with only a few towns and already had a ton of features that existed today. Though my only gripe as that even though it's a free to play game, you really get the benefits of the game by paying out of the wallet. Even though people say you don't need to. Over the years Mabinogi has tried to solve this problem by elimating some premium services and letting more free 2 play features into the mix.Now compared to 2004 there is always a lot of content. People who say who say it's "a generic MMO" haven't really looked deep into the game's mechanics and features. It's rare you find a game where you can use your own music in battle, or find a ton of minigames like you'd find in here.Still that doesn't mean that between 2004 and now this is now flawless. I still gripe about inventory space for free 2 play players. You most likely will be forced to get a pet eventually for lack of inventory space or buy their VIP service for more bags. Also their durability feature on equips is most frustrating, especially when it's not 100% chance that you might repair an equip completely. Some times even with a high-end computer lag might hit you as well, but that's unfortunately on the server end of the game. Also some quests can be a pain to do alone.But all of those gripes don't take away from the fun of the game. I highly reccomend playing the game through it's main and side quests for at least a couple weeks and join a guild and see if you are still enjoying the game.IGN: YuenRuairi server

Posted: July 18, 2013
												I'd recommend this game if the homestead houses were actual houses, and that'd be really nice for socializing, but they're not, soooo ♥♥♥♥ IT.The crafting in the game is beautiful, as is the lack of real class systems.  However, I don't particularly like the "bonus exp for talent" system.  Essentially, you now pick a class and when you do tasks from that class, you get more exp.Despite all this, I still recommend this game.  If you like the Anime art style, it's perfectly acceptable to enjoy.  If you don't MIND the art style and would like to play a game with interesting craft and harvesting systems with the ability to master every task in the game, then I recommend it.  However, if you find Anime grating at all on your nerves, you will puke 3 minutes into the game.

												Very fun plot line to play through and very addicting game ... though in the end game there is barely anything besides repeating commernceing, replaying the Saga plot lines and PvP. .... Well the " open PVP " system of paladin vs Dark Knight and Elf vs gaint is very broken meaning you die once and you basicly lose conintuously until you get to a healer's house to heal up but also you hit at 100% power to the other person thus you are doing hundreds if not throsands of dmg per hit and the max HP is only 1500 w/o trans anyways which only will bring it up as much as 1850 hp but stil that is a 4 hit kill and you revive with 5hp and the rest of it wound that cannot be restored with a normal HP potion. This is how that kind of PVP is broken. PVP via the Dualing system is better and what most ppl on Mabinogi use now as it lasts longer you do ussualy 1s but i ahve seen it go up to like 12 dmg some times when on 0% though good question how they got to 12 dmg when it should have been all 1 dmg hits. The plot is getting longer still and that is good and they are still tweaking it so the older skills are not always worse than the newer ones which i  also see as a good thing

content:
Posted: December 7, 2012
												Garbage piled up on more garbage built upon the sub-par foundations of more garbage. Its not a true RPG, but rather  a life simulater, with combat being a means to collect materials and money to buy pots and brooms and other such things. Its incredibly grind heavy, the enviroments ,though cell shaded and quite pleasnt, have a mixture of both High Level enemies mixed in with Low Level monsters that punishes players for trying to explore, griefers and goldsellers are abound, and the game actively pushed you to buy needless garbage. The only redeeming quailty I can say about the game is that the promotional character has a huuuuge pair of breasts, complete with exaggerated breast physics. All in all, for a true RPG experience rather than a Life simulater about making gloves shearing sheep, I suggest Vindictus, a prequal to Mabinogi thats based on the source engine and has an emphasis on combat. All in all 4/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												Love, love, love this game! This game has an exuberant amount of life skills, providing plenty of hours of entertainment. Life skills range from the standard mining/weapon crafting to cooking and music composition. I personally enjoy any game that allows for a lot of gathering of needed materials and this game surely provides. The fighting system is very involved, so don't expect a point a click. Defense is key to making it through dungeons. They are constantly updating their jobs and quests. The best part is the rebirth system. This allows you to start from lvl 1 while still retaining previous skill levels and an overall level as well as being able to change jobs. One week your a cook, the next a gunslinger. Out of all the free mmos I've played, this one definitely allows for greater amount of freedom than others. The quest and storylines are creative and unique. My only complaint (and it's huge), is that any tume there is an update I am suddenly unable to play the game. I can uninstall and reinstall the game but it doesn't seem to help. I have to wait (usually up to months later) to play the game. This has been happening to me for years; even before the game came to Steam and I have yet to still resolve the problem. Sadly though, the game is just too good for me to stay away permenantly.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
												This game has got me coming back over and over again, not only because it's a good MMO, but the friends that you make and the relationships you build through the impressive social community are outstanding. If you only played this game for the dungeons and etc, you're missing out on quite a bit. The character customization isn't the best, but they make up for it in gear. The game itself has a anime style touch to it and even had a Sword Art Online event at one point (Which I have Kirito's outfit, swords, and wings now ^.^). I think out of anything in this game, my favorite aspect is their music playing. You can play an instrument and even write your own music (if you know how to do it with MML). If you ever want to try out a game that has a nice social aspect aswell as combat, try out Mabinogi. Mabinogi is best played with friends or friends made along the way <3Although it says I've only played 0.2 hours. I have played much longer than that off of steam.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 27, 2013
												I feel like this game deserves a true review as it was such a major part of my life as a gamer a few years back. Though I haven't played it much as of late, I can honestly say that this was the best MMORPG that I have ever played. I was initially brought in due to the charming art style. As a child, I figured this would a simple, cute rpg that anyone could play with ease. While I was right about the easiness of getting into the game, the whole system as a whole is beyond amazing. The point and click system that was used early on was never cumbersome like other games I had played before then. Combat and movement felt fluid most of the time though there was the occasional moment of confusion on where my character was actually going.As for the story, I never really focused too much on the story as a child, I simply went through dungeons in order to level up. But after going back through some parts, I found the story rather charming. I was able to feel somewhat invested into the story despite feeling more like some mercenary that the REAL main characters used to do the dirty work. However, I didn't mind this too much as I still had ties to certain characters.Anyways, this is a game that one can easily get into; The community is mostly friendly, the controls work fine, and the general overworld is beautiful! My only major problem is that the economy seems to be in a horrible state ever since I played. Player shops rarely have items that anybody can afford. Though most items they sell aren't essential so it won't effect your experience much.My Overall Score: 8/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												Definitely pay to win, but if you don't mind a little grind you can do basically everything without paying a dime. To a lot of people that means a lot, but not so much to me. What I find most appealing about this game is the classless system, you can make your character anything and at any point you can change your mind and pick up something else. You aren't limited to one type of weapon or skill set based on the race you play or the weapon and skill set you choose to start with. Over time they have improved the tutorials at the beginning of the game to make it easier for new players to get started and the community in this game always seems to have a friendly vibe. Overall, it's a great game and I would recommend it. If you're hesitant about it, it's free and trying it can't hurt. It runs on low spec systems fairly well and has a good look to it even though it's aging as an MMO. What you won't find here are cutting edge graphics and animations, but it makes up for it in gameplay. Not saying the animations or graphics are bad, they are very good considering the generation of MMOs this game comes from.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Warning: This game, IMO is a WoW killer! Why? Well for many reasons, some more than others. Including:1. The rebirth system: This mechanic is actually the one main factor in all of this. Once you reach the age of 20 years old (Years in this game are weeks IRL), You can rebirth your character back to Level 1. I like this because it allows you to try different playstyles. If you're smart you'll actually invest in a playstyle that you like.2. The class system: This is a trip. See, the funny thing is, You actually don't need to restrict yourself to one playstyle. The only equipment restriction you have is in terms of clothing/armor. Classes instead give you access to learning certain skills that are exclusive to that class, as well as certain buffs. For example, The Mage class allows you to have an INT boost and extra Mana. This is also true for the Generational questline.3.Life Skills: These are unique in that they require a month of two of discipline to master! The variety is in this game. For once Devs kept their promise.Overall 8.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												Mabinogi is a complex fantasy world with a vast array of customization, from combat skills to life skills, and highly varied levels of equipments, abilities, and upgrades. My only criticism is that it is easy to lose to the "freedom" that the game gives you, and not be able to focus on a goal because of the willingness to explore so many different areas. There are a bunch of tutorials and beginner boosts to get you going and the many seasonal events keep the game fresh. Gachapon style awards in the cash shop are a pain, but every once in a while... you may get something nice. maybe. The story is very deep, so pay attention! Its definitely well thought out and well worth your time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												Mabinogi is a very open ended MMORPG with multiple main quests to play, lots of dungeons and events, lots of weapons and cool swag to snag, and lots of NX goodies... which thankfully isn't as required with the new updates. It's F2P, more so than ever these days actually. The game still suffers from lag, but it always has suffered from it. I blame the largeness of the game and the Fergus maintaned servers that are probably older to begin with. The game has customization that was almost unheard of at the time of it's creation (which is what really drew me in), and it still is pretty massive in terms of how unique you can make and build yourself.Lastly, an absolute blast with friends. It can get a bit boring and tedious alone, but find a few friends who play in real life, or find some friendly faces in the game, and you are in for a great time.Original circa 2012: This has got to be the best MMORPG I've ever played, sooo much fun with friends! There's so much to do, find, level, earn, many paths to go, etc!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												Pros:Do what you want- This game has so many skills the player can learn, both combat and lifestyle. What I really like about this is that if you are a warrior and you want to learn magic, of course you have to level it up but you don't lose your warrior skills or have to change to a different "class" like in other games. just switch weapons and there you go.  Combat- Rock, paper, scissors. Although that is much more engaging than other games where you just point and  click. Art Style- cute child friendly anime themeCommunity- one of the only mmos i know where random people would give an absolute stranger some items if they are new to the game. Even spend time explaining/ helping that person out if they have questions. This is from my own experience, results may vary.For new players- After making a new account, you do start with 6 character slots. Although if you are a returning player that made an account before this update, you are stuck with 1 (or 3 depending if you got the human, elf, and giant cards for free).Cons: (personal opinion)Combat- pretty slow pace since combat is more strategy than button mashing which might not go well for fast paced action lovers. Besides that my only issue is that the combat isn't very friendly to 1 versus crouds. you may counterattack one enemy but if another attacks on at the same time, it gets annoying. Then if you have enemy archers in mix, be prepared to just sit there stun locked.Graphics- I do like anime themed games and this isn't really a con, it's just that i wish they would update the models and animation to something that isn't early 2000s. Cash Shop- Im not sure since I dont look at the cash shop much but from what I can tell, most of the cash shop items are PURELY FOR AESTHETICS which i have absolutely no problem with. I dont this this game is anywhere close to pay to win which would make sense since I think this game is more social than competative. My only problem was that the "style tab" (armor put in the armor/ inventory tab effects defensive stats, armor put in the style tab only effects what your character looks like) which is usually free in other games you have to pay for in this one. Also once ingame, you only have like 10 costume sets to pick from everything else is cashshop or event. Grinding- SInce this game is more social than competative, there is no rush to become stronger than another person making grinding pointless. But if you are a person that wants to level their skills as fast as possible BE PREPARED, it will take a while.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												Mabinogi is a very open ended MMORPG with multiple main quests to play, lots of dungeons and events, lots of weapons and cool swag to snag, and lots of NX goodies... which thankfully isn't as required with the new updates. It's F2P, more so than ever these days actually. The game still suffers from lag, but it always has suffered from it. I blame the largeness of the game and the Fergus maintaned servers that are probably older to begin with. The game has customization that was almost unheard of at the time of it's creation (which is what really drew me in), and it still is pretty massive in terms of how unique you can make and build yourself.Lastly, an absolute blast with friends. It can get a bit boring and tedious alone, but find a few friends who play in real life, or find some friendly faces in the game, and you are in for a great time.Original circa 2012: This has got to be the best MMORPG I've ever played, sooo much fun with friends! There's so much to do, find, level, earn, many paths to go, etc!

												If you're looking for a fantasy life game that isn't the sims, play this first. This game is really fun with friends. Get friends, play with them. I've been playing on and off since I was about 10 or 11. I am now 16, still fun but the game has changed more than I would have liked it to. The social aspect is really awesome, the game isn't really suit for pvp unless you're dueling or have your trans pvp activated. One of the only things I don't like about it now is how it seems that it is beginning to die out of players, Alexina still says "new server" even though it came out before I even started playing, Nexon made it incredibly easier for new players to get a hold of the game if they're under level 1k (now new people wont know the struggle of having to wait for weeks just to rebirth). Other than the nostalgia of being a kid that it gives me, I have to say it is indeed one of the best MMO games I've ever played since it hits the dot when it says "fantasy life."

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Despite the amount of hours shown on my Steam account, I have played Mabi for the past 4 years through Nexon. And, I can tell you, it has been one of the best experiences ever.When I discovered Mabinogi through a friend, I was doubtful. I never really liked RPGs other than the FF series, but this game made me change my mind. Yes, it does have its bugs at times, and can lag a lot if you do not have a top notch computer, but the adventure and vast world make it all worth the while. Mabi has a very, VERY big world which has been growing for the past few years, so you'll never be bored by the everchanging scenery. There are literally an unlimited amount of quests to help you level up until you reach (probably, unsure since I haven't bothered to level very much) Lvl 900+. It is also extremely addictive if you have friends who are willing to play with you regularly. Most people on Mabi are friendly, so asking for help and befriending strangers are easy.In all, I would give this game a 9.5/10.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												Mabinogi is a complex fantasy world with a vast array of customization, from combat skills to life skills, and highly varied levels of equipments, abilities, and upgrades. My only criticism is that it is easy to lose to the "freedom" that the game gives you, and not be able to focus on a goal because of the willingness to explore so many different areas. There are a bunch of tutorials and beginner boosts to get you going and the many seasonal events keep the game fresh. Gachapon style awards in the cash shop are a pain, but every once in a while... you may get something nice. maybe. The story is very deep, so pay attention! Its definitely well thought out and well worth your time.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Definitely one of the best MMO experiences I've had. Mabinogi allowed me the freedom to♥♥♥♥♥♥around, to explore and discover things on my own. It won't hold your hand a ton but that's not to say it's brutally difficult. You really just do find your own way in its world.I had to leave it behind cold-turkey because I got addicted for nearly a month straight. It was just so cool to do trade runs, gather materials for crafting, attempt and often fail dungeons because I suck at combat... if I recall correctly the last thing I was doing was collecting creatures so that I could transform into them.I met a lot of interesting folks. One player posed as a dog and just barked and followed me around for a day. He helped a friend and I complete a tough dungeon and generally made that day's experience a ton of fun.The game is a bit antiquated in some respects but I was easily able to look past that and have a good time.Give it a fair try, maybe with a couple of friends, or make a couple of new ones in there. Or go solo if that's what you really want to do, maybe take pictures and do a blog about your journey.Just settle on down and play yourself some Mabinogi, bro. Enjoy it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												In the past, it was a great game that pushed for community.  As it grew, it became more and more solo focused.  The combat system was designed to be slow paced.  Would definitely recommend this game for those who enjoy developing their characters into a one-man killing machine.  Or those who just love fashion, or looking cute, or love to afk in towns.Recommendations for in-game:- Number 1 thing to do is: Visit the wiki, get an idea of which path you would want to start with.- Start by focusing on your life skills.  They will improve your combat abilities through passive means.- Rank each skill up one by one so that you can achieve Rank 1 in each.- Take advantage of your newbie status by resetting your Rank 1 skills so that you have more AP to rank another skill. (Recommended since you will be free to rank your skill back to 1 without training again)- Talk casually with people, ask and let them lord over you as if you need shelter from an invisible enemy. (There are good people who are understanding and make recommendations for skill paths or training methods, others will try to shove their methods down your throat)The Good (presently):- Game is largely solo-able since a large part of the community seems consist of isolated groups.- Story line is ok if you don't care how they butcher some mythological characters.- Combat is unique, inbetween fast and slow pace.  Used to run on a Rock-Paper-Scissors sort.- Life skills are extremely tedious, but is also the most rewarding.- Large variety of pets.- Huge map filled with life.The Bad (presently):- Community seems to be extremely immature and isolated.  Many are obessessed with PvP.- Skills are in no-way balanced for PvP while patches try improve the PvP scene.- Heavy on the Pay-to-win scale.  Pets are now stacked with beneficial buffs or attacks when summoned. (almost game breaking)- Group are hard to find for dungeons or challenges for new players.  Not many are willing to have a character that isn't stacked in their groups.- Latest Patches have made their gorgeous map into nothing worth exploring (very little reason to head out there and kill mobs)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												I've been a longtime player before this game was made available to steam, so here's some of my thoughts for you all:- If you're looking for a different mmo to settle down in  with good social AND combat aspects, consider playing this one. It's a great mmo to return to; especially if you're into long term commitment. There is a reason why this game's catchphrase is something akin to 'live your own life.' Every single skill you upgrade contributes towards the growth of your character.- There is no class system. There's specific skills filed under skillsets. Your role in combat is loosely determined by what skills you prioritize in ranking up. It's purely up to you how you want to play the game.- You can literally be every class if you wanted to.- Combat can take getting used to, but flows together well. You're allowed to be creative in your playstyle.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2012
												Other than having to re-download for steam, this is one of my favorite MMORPGs of all time. I highly recommend it to anyone with little or more MMORPG experience.One of Mabinogi's strong points is the skill system, there's no skill trees, allowing players to train themselves in whatever they want with no skill prerequisites. This allows for amazing party combinations, adapting to your fellow party members weaknesses and enhancing their strengths all at the hands of players and not forced into by the game itself.The quests are all pretty good with balanced rewards, never once have I been dissapointed with a quest or felt that I wasn't rewarded appropriately.

												I've gotten past being a newcomer, even though I'm still technically a "newbie" due to my total level being under 1,000. But so far, I've explored many talents, but the one I like the most is a tie between ninja and medicine. Thanks to my friendly guild, awesome friends and the diverse world of Erinn, I've found Mabinogi to be worth the time and effort. The events are awesome, and my current favorite was the SAO one! Although I'm on G3, I look forward to reaching G10 and on. The stories behind the Generations is, in itself, interesting but confusing when you start G1. I'd have to say expect the unexpected, and always be ready for fun! What really makes this game fun is the guilds and the community itself. I love my guild, Mythical, and I feel completely at home with it. With that said, I recommend trying at least one talent at a time to so you can find your perfect life for Mabinogi.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
												Mabinogi is a game where you need to be able to spend time, energy, and sadly for most gamers (ages 12-18 [generally): money. Otherwise, Mabinogi offers what is told by most game descriptions, age, unique combat, and plenty of costumes from any in-game event. Its certainly different from most MMORPG games, but if you want an easy anime life, then you'll need plenty of NX to spend. Either way, the dungeons have a decent difficulty curve, and the story is told in chapters, letting your character grow and develop on the way to the ending. The ending, however, is discovered after hundreds of quests you'll have to complete, and having friends to accompany you is very well recommended, and not just by the game. Some quests are near impossible without some comrades......and I speak from experience (damn golems.....). Mabinogi features plenty of skills to learn and master, and some of them aren't even combat related! Mabinogi is an MMO is one of those games you should play when you want to try something different, maybe even to play to meet some new friends. Either way, its your fantasy life!
