number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												Nexon saw World of Warcraft, thought "we could probably do better," and then spat out an anime-styled cutesy MMO for the masses to enjoy. I've been around for a good portion of it's lifespan... and through every generation as things grew bigger and I became a smaller and smaller part of the world, I sat back and enjoyed myself more and more. The choices that are there now are expansive and there's so many ways you can build your character. Don't fret, because how you build them doesn't matter! REBIRTH allows for you to start over again at level 0 if you are tired of being range-based. So you can follow your Mabinogi dreams and become a chef or a great mage or even just a fun little bard. Speaking of bards, they have a custom COMPOSING system which allows for one to fashion a song of their choosing/making. The possibilities are endless, especially if you are one for running dungeons like a classic MMO player. One drawback I can see is many parts of the game are locked/hard to get to without paying a bit of cash. Some character customizations are also premium only too, but that's mostly vanity stuff. It doesn't make it pay to win necessarily, it just makes dealing with travel and some skilling much easier, especially with a limited source of inventory slots and hotbars for skills. I still find it worthwhile to pay a little so you can play the game at it's fullest potential. The game is so expansive that I can even recount a time where I was pillowfighting with my sister in Dunbarton as our mounts went nuts trying to devour us. From what I remember, there are Humans, Giants, and Elves for racial picks, but if you buy any pets they not only carry stuff for you/between your characters more fluidly, but they also can be directly playable, so buying a flying mount can make you a taxi as well.All of that I just typed... Only a small portion of what's in store if you're up for it. Seriously, if you are into WoW, it's definitely worth checking out. Just remember that just like WoW, it's best to play with friends... 'Cept here you can go a step further and marry your friends and make them your family. Then go family dungeoning and recount endless adventures across Iria with them around a warm campfire.Mabinogi has events all the time, so it's wise to check in on it once in a time so you get LOTS of free stuff and more to pick from.I give it a 8/10. In comparison, I give a game like WoW a 6/10 due to the lack of a deep and extensive story. Mabi goes, in my opinion, too far to fill the blanks on your experience. Plus with all the events going on, odds are you'll make friends that will explain it all for you. I've had many amazing memories playing this game, and I am SURE you will too!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												As a person who played this game for about 4 years since the beta and then on and off again to see updates, I can honestly say that this game is not as fun as it could be. It's got blatent cash grabs all over the place. One of the biggest draws of the game is the deep character customization, but most of the costumes available are from cash only events or directly from random box items in the cash shop. The gameplay is interesting but poorly balanced. Every update brings a new flavor of the month. Anyways, I don't want to be too wordy, so here's a pro/con.Pros:Lots of character customization in looks and abilitiesA fair amount of content in the form of dungeons and missionsInteresting battle mechanicsCons:Frequently updates are just cash shop updatesLots of customization is locked behind a cash wallPoor balance in PvP (and sometimes PvE)Often exploitable bugs that trash the economy (and Nexon doesn't do the best at cleaning them up)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Mabi is, in a word, unique. On various levels. This is a game where you will never have to worry about a level cap. This is a game you can play hard, or play casual and you will still enjoy it. There are probably bigger 'sandboxes' to play in, the thing about Mabi is that there is always something more you can do be doing. Typically the problem is there is too much you could actually be doing. Fun to play with friends, easy to run around solo. Like every game it has its bugs and glitches, and quirks, its jerks and amazing people all in a row. I do recommend it, however I also recommend do not give up on it on first impressions. For those coming from a more, traditional, background RPG wise, it can be a bit clunky and difficult to understand. Ask around in game, on the forums, check out the game's wiki (we all use it) and give it a few hours gameplay and a few successes before you throw in the towel and give up on the style and mechanics. If you like being a bit of everything, or wish you could play a game with complimenting skillsets (and play both or any skill set at the same time) you can here, and we welcome you to Erinn.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												This game is easily one of my favorites. I've not played it as long as some people, but overall I've got around (Edit) 550 hours (Including Steam & Non-Steam Hours). The game has many stories in it, even some from Shakespeare, some of my personal favorites. There's plenty of events to keep you occupied. Even if you get bored of the game, which for me, was after around 150 hours, you'll be wanting to come back to it eventually and I played it even longer after coming back to it. Story : 10/10 - Takes far longer to beat than plenty of games I've ever played and has multiple stories. Graphics : 6.5/10 - The game runs on an older engine, so graphics aren't the best, but the artwork is beautiful.  Combat : 8.5/10 - While it certainly isn't as fun as the combat in TERA (Another amazing mmorpg), the combat is better than that of many mmo's I've played. Community : 7.5/10 - The game is rather old so there's not as many players as there could be on it. Overall, the community's fun, helpful, and rather friendly. As far as being helpful goes, many experienced players are willing to help new players get a grasp on the game's key features, especially combat.  Gameplay : 9/10 - There's enough to keep you busy for a while, so there's not much to hate about it.Overall, this game was great and I plan to keep coming back to it. The game definitely deserves more attention & players than it gets. If I was to go over everything in this game, this review would be several paragraphs longer so try the game out for yourself :PEdit: The only thing I disliked about this game was it being owned by Nexon. I've typically not enjoyed games they own but this one is different and doesn't have a pay-to-win feel like other games I've played.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Warning: This game, IMO is a WoW killer! Why? Well for many reasons, some more than others. Including:1. The rebirth system: This mechanic is actually the one main factor in all of this. Once you reach the age of 20 years old (Years in this game are weeks IRL), You can rebirth your character back to Level 1. I like this because it allows you to try different playstyles. If you're smart you'll actually invest in a playstyle that you like.2. The class system: This is a trip. See, the funny thing is, You actually don't need to restrict yourself to one playstyle. The only equipment restriction you have is in terms of clothing/armor. Classes instead give you access to learning certain skills that are exclusive to that class, as well as certain buffs. For example, The Mage class allows you to have an INT boost and extra Mana. This is also true for the Generational questline.3.Life Skills: These are unique in that they require a month of two of discipline to master! The variety is in this game. For once Devs kept their promise.Overall 8.5/10

Posted: August 7, 2014
												Among all of the MMOs and online multiplayer games I have played over the years, Mabinogi is truly a one of a kind game. Originally debuted in 2004 as a pay 2 play and transitioned to a free 2 play in closed beta, Mabinogi started off small with only a few towns and already had a ton of features that existed today. Though my only gripe as that even though it's a free to play game, you really get the benefits of the game by paying out of the wallet. Even though people say you don't need to. Over the years Mabinogi has tried to solve this problem by elimating some premium services and letting more free 2 play features into the mix.Now compared to 2004 there is always a lot of content. People who say who say it's "a generic MMO" haven't really looked deep into the game's mechanics and features. It's rare you find a game where you can use your own music in battle, or find a ton of minigames like you'd find in here.Still that doesn't mean that between 2004 and now this is now flawless. I still gripe about inventory space for free 2 play players. You most likely will be forced to get a pet eventually for lack of inventory space or buy their VIP service for more bags. Also their durability feature on equips is most frustrating, especially when it's not 100% chance that you might repair an equip completely. Some times even with a high-end computer lag might hit you as well, but that's unfortunately on the server end of the game. Also some quests can be a pain to do alone.But all of those gripes don't take away from the fun of the game. I highly reccomend playing the game through it's main and side quests for at least a couple weeks and join a guild and see if you are still enjoying the game.IGN: YuenRuairi server

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 13, 2016
												What a game! I first played this game in NA Closed Beta back in late February 2008, and then later on and off again. Every once and a while I played, the community seemed to change as well. Mabinogi is IMO a step up from Runescape, everything is improved and also more Free-to-play. That said, lets get on with the review.TUTORIAL and START:A long time ago, every player was restricted to the human race (which has the most stable tutorials and quests). After the G4,5,6 update, players could play as elves or giants as well (tutorials were a bit flaky). The tutorials basically teach you how to play the game basically, but for more exciting gameplay you would need to learn it on your own. Now, the tutorial for gameplay consists of you clicking on a board and being taught for about 30 minutes how to play in a certain class. For Elves and Giants, there are few tutorial quests before you are sent to copy the human tutorials (Effectively making the tutorials for elves and giants pointless). TLDR: Play as a human, you'll be handsomely rewardedRACES:There are 3 races in the game: Humans, Elves, and Giants. Humans are the most balanced of all, Elves excel in archery, magic, and life skills but are terrible in melee combat, GIants excel in melee combat and alchemy, but suck in everything else. The game is heavily biased towards humans as they get the best skills, armors, and overall stats. Next up would be elves, since they excel on the skills that are most important in the game. Giants get very little, less interesting skills, very little armors, and awkward hit boxes.MAINSTREAM QUESTS AND STORY:Personally I play Mabinogi for its story, since after a while there is nothing to do in this game. It's not like people talk to each in this game (More on that later). G1-3 update introduces probably the most "Play Me" like story. It's about 3 "Legendary Warriors" and how you interact with them. It ends in a very Korean drama like way. G4-8 update focused more on the development of the game, with new races, regions, and flight mode. However it really felt like there was not really an interesting story here. G9-12 probably featured the most complete story with no loose ends, and a lot of interesting features (Shadow Missions, Demigod mode, Brionac weapon, Alchemy). G13-16 destroyed the game and ruined the reputation by essentially copying Shakespherean plays and putting Mabinogi characters into there (You know when you know something Nexon does will be bad, and it really does comes out bad). G17-18 made the quests episodic and increased the amount of "Drama" in them, with the return and ruined reputation of the "3 Legendary Warriors". G19+ has been almost a revival of the game, where it seems the developers are trying to actually make some original content for once in almost 5 years.TLDR: There are a lot of different mainstream stories. They all seem to be modeled after K-Dramas, and almost all the NPC characters' reputations end up terrible as you progress through the stories.GAMEPLAY:The gameplay is incredible for when the game was released (2003 in Korea, which is 13 years ago). You can do almost anything in this game that RPGs offer, in addition to music making (The most unique feature of this game). The AI in this game used to be actually interesting with each enemy fighting in a certain pattern. As of now, all enemies just chase you and have their HP buffed to insanely high amounts. There are many different styles of fighting (Melee, Archery, Magic, Fighting, Alchemy, Gunnery, Puppetry, Ninja, Lancery). However they are not all balanced, so there are some styles of fighting clearly more advantageous than others. Crafting in the game consists of (Weaving, Tailoring, Refining, Blacksmithing, Cooking, Winemaking, Synthesizing, Metal Conversion, Magic Crafting, HIllwen Engineering, Mana Crystallization). It is really a grindfest just to participate in crafting in this game. MUSIC MAKING:The best and most unique feature of the game. You can compose music with Mabinogi Music Language and play it in the game for the community to hear. Of course every just copies their music from some where else. Some people actually put effort in the whole playing music thing in this game, where they buy a piano and play really complicated songs. For that effort, I am confused why those people would not just learn to play those songs in real life.LAST OF ALL, COMMUNITY:The most important thing about any MMORPG is its community. Mabinogi has had different groups of people play the game since I began playing it. In the beginning, a lot of players were new and there was a lot of adventuring in the game. Today, it has mostly ceased except the the Alexina server. Usually most people who are active in the game will be elitists who play with other elitists. The majority of the players in the game just AFK in Dunbarton trying to sell stuff for hours on ends. If you are a new player who wants to play this game, I heavily advise you to play on the Alexina server. Obviously this game is heavily involved with anime. That said, there are alot of weaboos present in the game (YOU have been warned). Also, "Fashionogi". Everybody invested in this game seems to have millions of pets filled with endless amounts of clothes to prance around in.RECOMMENDATION:Taking all these into account, I do recommend playing this game for at least a few hours to see what it offers. Today this game probably can not compare to other games, due to its aging graphics, maintenance, and dying community. A lot of players I have met over the 8 years I played this game have moved on to newer games. Mabinogi will forever be one of the greatest games I played (probably due to the time I played it, when everything was still new). That said, I probably would hate this game if I played it for the first time today. Because of all the new content, I have been slowly distancing myself from this game. It won't be very long until I myself completely quit the game.If you are looking for a more action based game with similar backgrounds, try Vindictus. It's the prequel of this game, but a lot entertaining to action based players with short attention spans.

												Edit: A more serious review of this game is that it is a fantastically bland looking generic game that has a wealth of depth in what you can pull off and put your time into for the game.I've never experienced a game that made me feel like I could do as much as I could playing this and nowadays despite the age of the game getting to itself if you can look past the janky buggy movement and gameplay you'll see the charm it holds.A more serious note on progression of this game is that it is surprisingly not that Pay2Win formula other reviews tend to give you a whole plethora of new player friendly content is out to ease the transition and the most you would ever feel encouraged to spend on is a mount or a pet for extra storage. The one argument that can made is that all the tools to make oneself into a stronger and steamrolling character exist but to feasibly pull this off would require hundreds if not more of real life money to pull off.If you ever plan on making it far in this game please be aware that the game treats skills and advancing as a slow more methodical approach with being consistent about your intentions to raise and level which can turn some people off if they're too used to MMO's since progression is more usually linked to gear/level progression.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												In the past, it was a great game that pushed for community.  As it grew, it became more and more solo focused.  The combat system was designed to be slow paced.  Would definitely recommend this game for those who enjoy developing their characters into a one-man killing machine.  Or those who just love fashion, or looking cute, or love to afk in towns.Recommendations for in-game:- Number 1 thing to do is: Visit the wiki, get an idea of which path you would want to start with.- Start by focusing on your life skills.  They will improve your combat abilities through passive means.- Rank each skill up one by one so that you can achieve Rank 1 in each.- Take advantage of your newbie status by resetting your Rank 1 skills so that you have more AP to rank another skill. (Recommended since you will be free to rank your skill back to 1 without training again)- Talk casually with people, ask and let them lord over you as if you need shelter from an invisible enemy. (There are good people who are understanding and make recommendations for skill paths or training methods, others will try to shove their methods down your throat)The Good (presently):- Game is largely solo-able since a large part of the community seems consist of isolated groups.- Story line is ok if you don't care how they butcher some mythological characters.- Combat is unique, inbetween fast and slow pace.  Used to run on a Rock-Paper-Scissors sort.- Life skills are extremely tedious, but is also the most rewarding.- Large variety of pets.- Huge map filled with life.The Bad (presently):- Community seems to be extremely immature and isolated.  Many are obessessed with PvP.- Skills are in no-way balanced for PvP while patches try improve the PvP scene.- Heavy on the Pay-to-win scale.  Pets are now stacked with beneficial buffs or attacks when summoned. (almost game breaking)- Group are hard to find for dungeons or challenges for new players.  Not many are willing to have a character that isn't stacked in their groups.- Latest Patches have made their gorgeous map into nothing worth exploring (very little reason to head out there and kill mobs)

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												This game is fabulous and bad at the same time. If there was a neutral button toward a review, this would be the one game I'd use it on. Here are some pro's & con's.Con's first, cause' it will grab your attention at the very finest.PS: , I mention this later but, I have around 2500 hours on this game and I've played for four years. Don't take my hours on the steam platform for granted please :)Cons:*BAD support, as far as I know, only half the people in their customer/tech support system actually do their job.*Money-hungry company, this game is 'considered' a pay to win due to the mere impossibility of doing things without money near-end game, but it's still a great experience otherwise.*Not much customization, in outfits, near early-game, which is rather considerably okay how they deal with it. Not really a con.//Some of these con's deal with the company that franchises it, the gameplay is, heavily, HEAVILY, different.Pros:*Epic combinations of skills that will leave you on your seat when you happen to get that unexpected boss kill ;D*Best community out there for a [mainly] free2play game.*Grand amounts of customization near mid-game, leading to epic skill combos, neat outfits, tools..*DUAL WIELDING, do I HAVE to explain this? They handle it so well.*It doesn't feel like a grind in the beginning or middle, near late game is where grindy stuff happens.*Memorable times...!*A VARIETY of amazing skills such as fishing, making a campfire, cooking even! These were added to make the game more realistic and overall bondworthy toward. It also makes some killer picnic's.*Realistic-like PVP , or, in this case, Duels. You literally walk up to someone, ask them if they want to duel. A menu comes up, you set the pre-requisites straight forward and get dueling. You aren't FORCED to do it either, and you can make good friends off of it.*Graphics are easy to render, a lower-end / mid-end computer could easily run 30-100FPS. The game was made around 2000-something if I recall. The graphics still look amazing though.//*Death penalty system is not degradeful, hated, or anything in particular. It is annoying when you die, you get Nao stones to revive on full health sometimes though, and even if you do die, you don't lose anything. There is a chance when you die you may lose your gear if its expensive and not blessed by a certain item, but you can get it back at a town hall for a .. 'reasonable yet sometimes a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ kind of price.//*And finally, its NOT a rage game. Well, not easily alas. Sometimes there are mobs that can truly p1ss off someone but other than that, you don't lose very much.//\\Oh and, don't take my hours for granted. This game was just recently platformed on steam, it used to be on the companies website, which doesn't, as you may know, transfer hours over to here.I've played Mabinogi for four years! Highly inactive, but I at least have 2500 hours on the game and I've witnessed all the stuff they've done on it.//\\This is a more TL:DR Version::!!//\\There are plenty more cons to the game, but they are outweighed heavily by the amount of pros this game contains. The community is so well knitted together that even a child could have fun without any pervs or foul language to watch out for. It's fun, engaging, and most of all, it's made for a community. You can manage epic combos in combat, you can even have pets. Its pretty cool, and is definitely worth trying.However, the support service/s are typically bad, but you can still manage a refund if you didn't get something you payed for. They are money hungry , as they support many different games imported from Japan, and I can understand that. When they ask for too much money though, its pretty noticable. Back on the topic of the game though, there isn't much customization in the beginning, so its kind of boring. If you keep on going though, you'll find it pretty epic overall.--//...An even more TL;DR version..!! ;//\\Fun / Engaging game; but has a bad support service / company. It is a near pay to win at the end, but it is still very fun. It's also very involved with the community, most people are friendly and you don't have to watch out for swear-a-holics. A 9 year old could play this and learn to be kind from the community, most of the time.//OVERALL SCORE, the moment you've been waiting for..I give this game an 8.5 / 10  !!The reason I knocked off 1.5 points was rather simple, just the bad service and company it is owned by in America and the 'noticable yet not overkill' hunger for money they desire to keep the game rolling. Here is a more in-depth explanation.+1 - Great graphic design, even for a game made near 2000. It can also handle lower-end computers well.+3 - Epic community for a free-to-play game, it is very well knitted together, its hard to rip apart. Very hard.+4.5 - Amazing combat system, PVP, and gameplay in general. Has a killer storyline too.-1.5 - Aside from all that, the game has a bad support system and is a mere pay to win near the end. You can still have a great time though.Thanks for reading through this, I hope I've told you the most I could about this fabulous game.-~Kon

												    Community is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ now most guilds require rediculously high total levels with two alternatives which happen to be new guilds (which usually die given a few weeks) or guilds with so much drama involved you'll be wanting to leave in a matter of hours. The skill systems suck now. When I first started playing mabinogi years ago the skill system was perfect the enemy AI was actually intelligent and made the game difficult which was FANTASTIC. With the addition and revamping of so many skills and now getting AP for talents it makes the game hilariously easy.   Sure hope you like spending money! Because if you like to save your money, back the ♥♥♥♥ away now! This game is pay to win and I should know as I've spent more than my fair share of money on this bucket of crap. Pets are basically useless now. Before it was difficult to beat the game without some kind of pet because the difficulty curve actually existed. Now Nexon is coming out with pets worth $12 that ♥♥♥♥ing SING ALONG WITH YOU.   Sure hope you don't like customer service when it comes to nexon. One of my accounts was banned years back for no particular reason and I sent a ticket in and I never heard a damn thing about why my account was banned. So within a span of about 3-4 years I sent in a total number of 15 tickets and NONE of them had even been touched by the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cutomer "service" representatives. There are also absolutely NO refunds here. Trust me I did try to get my money back from wasting at least $200 on my at the time recently banned account.  The events are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and are recycled every year. You're lucky if you happen to see an event from a few years back and that's what they say is "New and shiny events" more like trash that they shined up for you so they could stick it up your♥♥♥♥♥easier. On occasion they'll add a new event but generally it's so boring you'll wish there were no events. Mabinogi makes it now so that there is ALWAYS an event but it just...It just doesn't work.All in all the game just isn't all that fun anymore. I certainly would not recommend it anymore.

												I have played mabi from the first generation and on and off for every year, sometimes doing speed runs on different characters. It's a good mmo to create a character you like and play with.

												It's a good, casual game. Not for heavy upgraders and character maxers. It takes a long time to get up in levels, months, years, just to get where you want. It is fun, though, with so many options. You'll never really run out of things to do. It's more like you get tired of not having enough people around to do all that you can do.The first Saga is a must to finish, for the free pet. You get free pets, but each character can get a free pet from the saga, and the inventory is worth it. Always make your characters on the same server. Get a human first for free giant and human cards. And to anyone who says money is hard to get, it really isn't. Do events, sell your potions, and get a gold talent for hard-mode missions (with some strong people to drag you through it, and pick up all the gold they leave).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 5, 2016
												Personal review 9.5/10Objective review 5/10I love this game. I played this game since it was beta and this is game that literally grew up with me. Whenever I play this game I have nostalgic feeling of me playing this game when I was elemantary student. Some people say WoW is game that people can never quit, but keeps on coming back, but for me this is a game that I will never ever quit (unless it closed down) and will probably be my first and last MMORPG.Reason I like this game so much is you have so much things to do. You can play this game socially by joining guilds. You can play this game going through quests. You can play this game playing music within game with different kinds of instruments. You can play this game doing all kinds of things such as trading/farming and so on. Even though graphic may somewhat look outdated, it kinda shows how old this game is.However, I also find it disturbing how this game changed so much to pay to win. While this game is free to play and therefore you dont have to pay any money, in reality, you kinda do if you want to take some part in the game. For beginners this game can be really hard because if you start this game literally from the blank, you will have tough time going through anything. Even though there are many features u can enjoy, you need funds. So overall do I recommend this game? Yes I do. Even though this game has gotten somewhat pay to win game, regardless it is great game and there are so many things you can to enjoy this game. If you are tired of WoW type MMO which just repeats quest - raid - pvp cycle, I definitely recommend this game. I wish future MMO adapts Mabinogi.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
												Mabinoji is overall a well polished game. The graphics and theme are appealing and I found this game very fun to play. However, I have always had a problem with it's quests. Sometimes, they tell you to return a quest to an NPC, and they don't tell you where the heck that NPC is. I am sometimes really frustrated by this. Also, this is not a game that you can play solo. The dungeon's difficulty increases exponentially. The first maybe two dungeons you could do on your own, but anything after is nearly impossible without a party. Also the inventory idea in this game is terrible. You have like 100 inventory space in your bag. Tht doesn't sound too bad right? Think again. The Items aren't limited to one inventory space, so I often have to throw things away just to get my reward for my quest. This feature does make the game more realistic, but it makes the game feel less and less fun. The storyline is pretty good, but it is hard to follow, because you have to complete a dungeon to get to the next storypoint. And as I mentioned earlier, you just can't solo it. This game does have many problems, but I would definitely recommend playing it.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												Definitely one of the best MMO experiences I've had. Mabinogi allowed me the freedom to♥♥♥♥♥♥around, to explore and discover things on my own. It won't hold your hand a ton but that's not to say it's brutally difficult. You really just do find your own way in its world.I had to leave it behind cold-turkey because I got addicted for nearly a month straight. It was just so cool to do trade runs, gather materials for crafting, attempt and often fail dungeons because I suck at combat... if I recall correctly the last thing I was doing was collecting creatures so that I could transform into them.I met a lot of interesting folks. One player posed as a dog and just barked and followed me around for a day. He helped a friend and I complete a tough dungeon and generally made that day's experience a ton of fun.The game is a bit antiquated in some respects but I was easily able to look past that and have a good time.Give it a fair try, maybe with a couple of friends, or make a couple of new ones in there. Or go solo if that's what you really want to do, maybe take pictures and do a blog about your journey.Just settle on down and play yourself some Mabinogi, bro. Enjoy it.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												First off, if you're into anime/manga-- great! Mabinogi will probably appeal to you with its chibi-esque appearance/graphics. The game has multiple facets (all not included here): you can dungeons, farm, do daily jobs from various NPCs in town, romance players with your music playing abilities. Your character can age, lose/gain weight... and you can even "reset" by choosing the "rebirth" option. Dungeons can be solo'd or done in groups: all set up in a labyrinth-esque scheme.All in all a good game, but it gets a bit repetitive/boring after a while. If you're looking to kill time, check it out: but other than that, Mabinogi doesn't have enough substance in my opinion. The added fact that there is a cash shop available for players that want to get ahead or customize their characters further doesn't help either.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2012
												Mabinogi is a very open ended MMORPG with multiple main quests to play, lots of dungeons and events, lots of weapons and cool swag to snag, and lots of NX goodies... which thankfully isn't as required with the new updates. It's F2P, more so than ever these days actually. The game still suffers from lag, but it always has suffered from it. I blame the largeness of the game and the Fergus maintaned servers that are probably older to begin with. The game has customization that was almost unheard of at the time of it's creation (which is what really drew me in), and it still is pretty massive in terms of how unique you can make and build yourself.Lastly, an absolute blast with friends. It can get a bit boring and tedious alone, but find a few friends who play in real life, or find some friendly faces in the game, and you are in for a great time.Original circa 2012: This has got to be the best MMORPG I've ever played, sooo much fun with friends! There's so much to do, find, level, earn, many paths to go, etc!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Warning: This game, IMO is a WoW killer! Why? Well for many reasons, some more than others. Including:1. The rebirth system: This mechanic is actually the one main factor in all of this. Once you reach the age of 20 years old (Years in this game are weeks IRL), You can rebirth your character back to Level 1. I like this because it allows you to try different playstyles. If you're smart you'll actually invest in a playstyle that you like.2. The class system: This is a trip. See, the funny thing is, You actually don't need to restrict yourself to one playstyle. The only equipment restriction you have is in terms of clothing/armor. Classes instead give you access to learning certain skills that are exclusive to that class, as well as certain buffs. For example, The Mage class allows you to have an INT boost and extra Mana. This is also true for the Generational questline.3.Life Skills: These are unique in that they require a month of two of discipline to master! The variety is in this game. For once Devs kept their promise.Overall 8.5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												When one first enters into Mabinogi, it will seem like a simple MMORPG.But it's not, it's like calling TF2 a simple FPS.What makes this game unique is how it gives so many approaches and how immersive it is.You can be a chef that smashes things with a hammer, or a puppeteer who fights by controlling puppets twice your size. And unlike most MMORPGs which take to grinding to make any money or levels, Mabinogi uses an intriguing and original way to avoid this droning method of advancement.While there is indeed content that requires real money that adds on to the experience. Playing it free by itself is still worthwhile and satiating for the gaming palette, especially if you enjoy immersion.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 6, 2015
												I've only just started playing this game but thus far I really like it. A lot of the people playing are pretty friendly as long as you aren't rude and the game is pretty easy to figure out when you get in. The first thing I would want to say though is that going into this I did make 2 characters, one of them was used for learning to play the game, and the other was used to play once I figured the game out. idk if this was a good Idea but I feel like with the first character I was able to make all the mistakes I needed to make while learning and not worry about it affecting the rest of my gameplay experience.That being said it didn't take me long to figure the game out and if you're used to most basic MMO style gameplay then you should be able to figure out a lot of the concepts and UI placement pretty quickly. When I started I played as a basic human warrior and I have to say that I had a lot of fun with the combat. The fighting style with close combat is very fun and it feels like when you're hitting things you're actually doing something. The second talent I tried was magic because I thought it might be kinda fun to use magic at a distance and then beat my enemies down with my sword when they got close. I do have to say that to me personally I didn't think that the magic felt very rewarding to me. It seemed like I was just kinda poking things and making them angry and I found myself using my swords a lot more often.Another thing I noticed that I actually really liked is that you can go anywhere. If you want to wander into an area with mobs that are much stronger than you, the game won't tell you that you can't. I mean you will obviously get murdered going in there but I feel like it makes the game more fun when exploring because you don't know how powerful a mob is compared to you in a new area until you attack it. The sense of exploration and not knowing if you'll get your♥♥♥♥♥handed to you the second you attack something makes the game a lot more fun for me personally.Again this is all low level beginner experiences of mine and the gameplay could become much better as you become higher level. I feel that this game is probably going to become kind of an addiction for me but this is also the first 2 weeks of me playing this game. I would recommend this game to anyone that enjoys MMO style games and loves exploration in games.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
												I'm sure for those that it works for, this game is a lot of fun. It looks really neat and I love the idea of being able to choose between being an adventurer, or just chilling and going for a more relaxed alternative like becoming a chef or a tailor, or a farmer and fisherman/woman. Unfortunately, the game keeps freezing for me repeatedly no matter what. After creating my character, it froze while loading me into the world to begin. I couldn't find any way to close out of the game, as nothing on my keyboard worked. So I was forced to shut down my computer just so I could close the game. Still hoping it would work, I tried loading it up a second time and I thought it was fine. I could move around, perform actions (Like laughing, greeting, dancing, disapproving ect) but I heard no background music. So I found the Menu button and tried to hit Options, hoping I could turn the music on and maybe figure out what I ought to be doing. Unfortunately, when I hit Options, my game froze once more and I could find no means of escaping. F1-12 buttons didn't work, neither did the Fn keys, and not even the ever reliable Escape key let me get out of the game. I am not sure if its because this particular mmorpg is popular, and therefore it has terrible and severe lag....or my laptop just can't handle it. Unfortunately, the game keeps freezing for me repeatedly no matter what. After creating my character, it froze while loading me into the world to begin. Still hoping it would work, I tried loading it up a second time and I thought it was fine. I could move around, perform actions (Like laughing, greeting, dancing, disapproving ect) but I heard no background music. So I found the Menu button and tried to hit Options, hoping I could turn the music on and maybe figure out what I ought to be doing. Unfortunately, when I hit Options, my game froze once more and I could find no means of escaping. F1-12 buttons didn't work, neither did the Fn keys, and not even the ever reliable Escape key let me get out of the game. I am not sure if its because this particular mmorpg is popular, and therefore it has terrible and severe lag....or my laptop just can't handle it. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 14, 2014
												Mabinogi, A fun filled online MMO RPG game. A completly free to play and not a pay to win game! I started back in 2012 I think it was, when transformation first came out as long as the cheetah pet, so I have a pretty vast knowledge about the game. It's a difficult game to get into at first because it's a old fashioned MMO and is a slow pace game. You have to be ready to spend major time into this game, and be committed if you want to get good at it. I have shown this game to a major amount of my friends, and 75% quit the game straight up because it is a diffcult game to understand when you first start. I personally love challanges, so for me this is quite what i was looking for. I would give a hands down to all the benifits they added to new players, it makes the game 100 times easier and with the new rebirth for free untill level 1000, it makes the game more easier and faster to finish (less waiting time).ALSO NOOBS GET TWO FREE MOUNTS! Games never do that... Nexon seems to be keeping the game fresh with ideas and new events every few weeks are so, so the game never gets boring. The community is very sweet and easy to co-op with as well and there are many friendly people. Mabinogi has many multiplayer cabillity so it is very fun to play with your peers. The game is very unique and I never played anything like it. It has a large range of things you can change on your character (face, hair, outfits) so you can personlize yourself how ever you want. The game is also completely free to play, and you can beat it without having memberships. (ex. World of Warcraft) The downside is you have to pay to get unique mounts, but they now added to where new players can get a horse and eagle mount for free. The combat system is very different, and basicly have to use the keyboard to preform skills, kind of like League in a way. Many talents/classes are avalible to choose from, and you never have to stay with just one, you can switch constantly. So the expierence never gets old. A new talent/class comes usually bout every year or so. Anyways to sum this all up, I recommend anyone who is up for a challenge and up for a wonderful expierence to play this game. And I wish you the best of luck to becoming a Grandmaster. Final rating: 10/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
												I have currently put around 70 hours into this game (the most hours i have put into a steam game) and i find this game very enjoyable, as it really is the first mmorpg that i have decided to play for more than three days. This game has more to it than your typical rpg, with just the mainstream classes like mage, archer, and warrior (it has these classes as well), but has different classes such as bard, puppeteer, battle alchemist, and more fun classes. In this game "Classes" are known as talents, you choose a talent and you get more exp in that "class". This does not mean that you cannot master other skills, you just get more exp. There are different types of talents, such as Life talents which are like talents you practice outside of dungeoneering and monster slaying. Examples of these are: cook, Tailor, smithing, and music. That is all i have to say, i really recommend this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
												Mabinogi is a different type of MMORPG that allows you to be good in multiple "Talents" (Talents are pretty much classes). The talent system allows you to be a Mage-Ninja-Chef that can dual wield guns; it really allows for you to be anything you want, and there are other aspects of the game that don't have their own talent like fashion (Tons of outfits). The social aspect of the game is what kept me on most of the time. It's just amazing meeting some overall nice people. The PvP in Mabinogi is broken at the moment in my opinion. PvP is 30% Skill, 20% total level, and 50% Equipment(PAY TO WIN). The current state of the game is laggy at times for my high-end computer, a decently low amount but just enough to♥♥♥♥♥♥you off bugs, and low in players on all servers except Alexina. I would totally recommend this game to people who are into MMORPGS and some that are just into RPGS since I've found myself going through quite a bit of MMORPGS before I played Eve Online for years and then came to Mabinogi. I've been spoiled by the amount of freedom that Mabinogi has that I couldn't even get into Black Desert. It does not make Mabinogi a better game than Black Desert but the freedom aspect is just very appealing to me. There is an Ingame market that allows players to trade almost all items for gold or exchange directly between players.----------------------------------------------------Pros+FreedomStoryCommunityCustomization----------------------------------------------------Middle Ground+-Anime style elementsPvEMarket----------------------------------------------------Cons-lagbugsPvP (Pay-to-Win)Graphics----------------------------------------------------If you join Mabinogi feel free to send me a note (IGN: Kavah | Server: Alexina)

content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												This game is easily one of my favorites. I've not played it as long as some people, but overall I've got around (Edit) 550 hours (Including Steam & Non-Steam Hours). The game has many stories in it, even some from Shakespeare, some of my personal favorites. There's plenty of events to keep you occupied. Even if you get bored of the game, which for me, was after around 150 hours, you'll be wanting to come back to it eventually and I played it even longer after coming back to it. Story : 10/10 - Takes far longer to beat than plenty of games I've ever played and has multiple stories. Graphics : 6.5/10 - The game runs on an older engine, so graphics aren't the best, but the artwork is beautiful.  Combat : 8.5/10 - While it certainly isn't as fun as the combat in TERA (Another amazing mmorpg), the combat is better than that of many mmo's I've played. Community : 7.5/10 - The game is rather old so there's not as many players as there could be on it. Overall, the community's fun, helpful, and rather friendly. As far as being helpful goes, many experienced players are willing to help new players get a grasp on the game's key features, especially combat.  Gameplay : 9/10 - There's enough to keep you busy for a while, so there's not much to hate about it.Overall, this game was great and I plan to keep coming back to it. The game definitely deserves more attention & players than it gets. If I was to go over everything in this game, this review would be several paragraphs longer so try the game out for yourself :PEdit: The only thing I disliked about this game was it being owned by Nexon. I've typically not enjoyed games they own but this one is different and doesn't have a pay-to-win feel like other games I've played.

												I'd say this game has lived quite past its glorious day, but most of its features can be interesting.Firsthand, the crafting system feels a bit more involved, for you actually have to toss-in inputs in order to gain improved results, which is quite an interesting twist on the standard MMORPG's way of rolling with that.The combat system feels a bit awkward at first, but that issue will eventually disappear with time.The main issue I can perceive so far is related to the low server population, but it is quite normal at this advanced stage of existence.Lastly, if you enjoy life skills and some creative class design, this game has plenty of them to entertain you for quite a while.

												If you're looking for a fantasy life game that isn't the sims, play this first. This game is really fun with friends. Get friends, play with them. I've been playing on and off since I was about 10 or 11. I am now 16, still fun but the game has changed more than I would have liked it to. The social aspect is really awesome, the game isn't really suit for pvp unless you're dueling or have your trans pvp activated. One of the only things I don't like about it now is how it seems that it is beginning to die out of players, Alexina still says "new server" even though it came out before I even started playing, Nexon made it incredibly easier for new players to get a hold of the game if they're under level 1k (now new people wont know the struggle of having to wait for weeks just to rebirth). Other than the nostalgia of being a kid that it gives me, I have to say it is indeed one of the best MMO games I've ever played since it hits the dot when it says "fantasy life."

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												In the past, it was a great game that pushed for community.  As it grew, it became more and more solo focused.  The combat system was designed to be slow paced.  Would definitely recommend this game for those who enjoy developing their characters into a one-man killing machine.  Or those who just love fashion, or looking cute, or love to afk in towns.Recommendations for in-game:- Number 1 thing to do is: Visit the wiki, get an idea of which path you would want to start with.- Start by focusing on your life skills.  They will improve your combat abilities through passive means.- Rank each skill up one by one so that you can achieve Rank 1 in each.- Take advantage of your newbie status by resetting your Rank 1 skills so that you have more AP to rank another skill. (Recommended since you will be free to rank your skill back to 1 without training again)- Talk casually with people, ask and let them lord over you as if you need shelter from an invisible enemy. (There are good people who are understanding and make recommendations for skill paths or training methods, others will try to shove their methods down your throat)The Good (presently):- Game is largely solo-able since a large part of the community seems consist of isolated groups.- Story line is ok if you don't care how they butcher some mythological characters.- Combat is unique, inbetween fast and slow pace.  Used to run on a Rock-Paper-Scissors sort.- Life skills are extremely tedious, but is also the most rewarding.- Large variety of pets.- Huge map filled with life.The Bad (presently):- Community seems to be extremely immature and isolated.  Many are obessessed with PvP.- Skills are in no-way balanced for PvP while patches try improve the PvP scene.- Heavy on the Pay-to-win scale.  Pets are now stacked with beneficial buffs or attacks when summoned. (almost game breaking)- Group are hard to find for dungeons or challenges for new players.  Not many are willing to have a character that isn't stacked in their groups.- Latest Patches have made their gorgeous map into nothing worth exploring (very little reason to head out there and kill mobs)

												EDIT 2: This game is quite interesting to the fact that you can learn other skills and talents by using the item associated with the action/talent. For example:I use a bow "You have gained knowledge about the Archery Skill!" I read a book on magic,"You have gained knowledge about the Lightning Bolt Skill"! I don't have too terribly much expierience with MMORPGs,but I still think this feature is great. Being able to become a Martial Arts Mage,or an Alchemist Archer,or an Chef Knight. and so forth.EDIT 1: The video on the store page is what the players of this game dream of.The game is still great,but there's just not a lot of player-to-player interaction anymore. If you want action in this game,you'll have to make it yourself. The servers aren't very crowded (hooray?).Sadly,almost everyone online is away-from-keyboard,BUT there are a few good souls who will be your friend and help you out.ORIGINAL:It's a good game,as far as I've played. It's controls will take some getting used to(space bar,for example,isn't a 'jump' button,but it's the combat mode on/off button).It's a manga/anime massivley-online multi-player role playing game. The Inventory isn't THAT big,not a problem for me,maybe for someone else,but not me. And MAN,you can choose you AGE when you are creating your character,so here's a game where you can kick rear as a six-year-old(I may be wrong). Gold isn't too hard to find,but you'd better be loaded when you go shopping!If you want to know the Plusses of the game,play for yourself,or read someone else's review,BUT PLEASE,NEXON,ADD BACK INTO THE GAME THE PARTNER SLOT!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												Well, where to begin? This game has aged poorly in the aspect that it doesn't run too well on modern systems. Otherwise for being 8 years old it has a fairly active (and friendly) community. To this day it still sees updates and varying other things. This was one of my first MMORPGs (the other being Fiesta). Seeing it grow and change has amazed that something can run for so long. I wish they would've released Mabinogi 2 (not that Vindictus♥♥♥♥♥♥ so Mabi could continue to run for another generation of gamers. But onto the actual review and not nostalgia. This game is a very unique MMORPG being advertised as "you can be anything!" And it doesn't lie. You can be a singer, a battlemage,  a archer, or a combination of the varying amounts of skills in this game. The levelling system is unique as in you can level and then "rebirth" your character which results in removing your current levels but you keep your skills. Your levels are, in a sense, saved in a total level. Mine being about 500-700, is fairly low, especially seeing as I have friends who have multiple characters at 4K+ levels. One of the downfalls is the sort of need of pets because you'll eventually run out of space. Going onto another downfall is how poorly it runs on current systems. This game was made 8 years ago and it struggles to support current-end parts. The community, when they aren't AFKing in Dunbarton or wherever, are usually super friendly and are willing to guide you through almost anything. One thing I do miss is some of the people I used to play with when I was a lot younger but dropped Mabi due to IRL things and lost contact with. But even then, I've found new friends who in a sense replace them but are completely unique from my original friends. All in all, if you disregard the graphics, this is an amazing game that truly needs a reboot on a new engine.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												I'm going to re-write my review of this game, just because it has changed since I played it. Unfortinitly, my thumb is still going to point twords the floor.  This game has a good sized world, it has many skills, and over the years has had some very nice improvments and new content. It also still has many bugs and while new stuff does get added and older programming does get changed at times, older textures and meshes rarely ever get updated, specialy if they involve wearables.   I wont go over skills and such much, I recommend trying the game for yourselves for that, but I will warn you that this game is not great at being pay-free as some would like to say, as pets ($), while unneeded, are about as unneeded as a car is, it's not a great idea to advoid them. There are boosters and the such you can buy with money aswell, but most of these actualy are not needed unless you're looking for a edge, but pvp is kinda a dead joke in this game. Then you get Nexon's -Amazing- customer support, of which I can only assume work at EA as well. Really, you -will- get problems with them eventualy, eithor through payment info randomly being perma blocked or through them randomly banning accounts. I have not had my account banned, but I have had friends, ones that don't do stupid stuff, get banned for no reason and dispite many ticket requests never get a reason as to why or a way to defend themselves.   Another downfall of this game is the extream lack of keybinding. while you can shortcut some UI keys, anything skill-related you are stuck with # keys and F# keys. No exception unless you own a Naga, in which case... why are you looking at this game?! (To be fair, I do not own a Naga mouse, and am just assuming the hotkey-program that it uses will works with mabi)    Now, I have a lot of gripes with this game and its p*ss poor support, but I also have a lot of great memories with it. As the saying goes, it's not the game that makes it fun, it's the people, and there is a good amount of good people in this game. As a new player, you also get a good amount of story quests and exploration to do, which I highly recommend exploring the world before trying to save it.   It is not a bad game, more that it is ran by a bad company, which as much as it dissapoints me, is the main reason why I can not give this game a good review, because it is loosing players every year, and Nexon just keeps trying to milk it for money, providing new content as a way to try and draw new players in to their failing game. Unfortinitly, their business practices will not change, and that will keep most new players from staying.

												Wellp. I just broke 1.6k hours. Recorded On Steam at least. I've been playing this game long before it was available on steam and I gotta say its one of my faveorite MMOs out there. The learning curve is steep and the engine is defiantly showing its age (over 10 years now) but it still has the core of what mmo's used to be like ages ago.  The sandbox elements are pretty good and despite the change of directors over the years shifting the design away from what it originally was I still find myself coming back.If you were to try this game you need to prepare to look over it's short comings due to the dated engine and be willing to learn it's systems as they are very different from other games and are not explained too well in game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 11, 2013
												Mabinogi is a very drab game. It advertises endless possibilities and mountains of content, when in reality the only real things you can do involve trading and stabbing bears. The combat is too lopsided, the story is too KAWAII-DESUUUUUU~ and the economy is a huge mess. Dungeons are boasted as in-depth and randomly generated, which they are (kinda). Small enemies can kill you just as quickly as you can kill them, and bosses require a couple of players (or luck, in most cases) to beat, which kills it for me because I like being able to solo most things. Armor does nothing, surprisingly, and you're better off saving your money up for weapons and potions than splurging on armor. There's also a wound system that requires you to use bandages before potions do any good, forcing you to waste even more time. Everything is a grind and nothing is rewarding. Good luck getting anything done. Trust me, you'll need it.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												Hi it's Mininight From Alexina Server Here.This is My personal Review on Mabinogi.First things first, I Am An Old, Player, Not the kind that afk, leave game open. I can usually be on most days of the week, But enough about me, this is about the game.This game Used to really give you the sense of Adventure, and exploring the continents, without so many moon gates and the moon gate book, It used to let everyone explore, you used to be able to be with friendly groups of people to hangout with  and do things in the game with, that aren't trolls, scammers. and worse Them Alts... etc. But now it's kinda full of them. You also used to get the feeling of achieving something good. That is gone now to.I don't like how every begginer player gets recomended to do ninja talent. That is unbelievably grindy, and ive done it. Will make you want to quit, For awhile. or forever. But i do like the reset feature benefit, But i think it needs to be explained more, To new players, So you can learn how to exactly train each skill and talent. Also Explain how to get ap from it, its a very useful feature, alot of people ignore, and don't know of it. This Game has so much Potential. But i don't like how its all going down the drain.The Market is really crazy, also can be very hard. If it's crafting or selling mats, all im going to say is that its super grindy and when you sell the stuff and or gear, People are willingly to buy it in bulk and under valued... So your kinda better off crafting for yourself or for your friends..Life skills are very Grindy and need to be updated badly. Same with obtaining some materials easier like fine finest leathers. Increasing the fishing list and have a fishing contest mini game. some other stuff to.The guild system has been alright, But that need to be updated to, especially the guild features Like The guild hall, should atleast be able to decorate it. Also the Guild robe. The Guild pvp has potential. At the moment not that good.pvp about pvp, It needs to be balanced properly, Also the pvp currently is kinda bad because its full of stunlocking, to me that's super cheap and boring...Commercing, I used to like commercing but i tend to get a dismounting/ mounting problem. Commercing can be fun and worth it, if the commerce shop gets updated, Bounty hunting can be fun. Rafting i used to enjoy rafting, But that honestly needs to be updated and it's really displacement buggy. Same with the rafting shop id like to see some better stuff in there. The current way of the Spirit Weapon System is Built it, ehh, Really not worth it, can take years to get the gems and powders and so much money to level one up Also maintain it's dura. Also Needs to Be updated. Like adding the rest of the weapons to the list. Repair rate I honestly think it should stay and be at 100% without having your item, losing max dura, because it'd cost so much to get the dura back up. That and upgrading enchanting and reforging an item is so costly, Nobody really deserves it being not useable. Because of dura.Shadow missions can be fun, But the end chests need new and better stuff. Would like to see new bosses, etc in them. Also new shadow missions. As for shadow crystals, People way overprice those now. The raids are fun. But all the other raids, other than girgashy and the black/white dragon, I think those need better drops. Girgashy raids though, when it comes to that, Most of the people i notice that do those, are really strict Unhelpful unfriendly elitists. They can be very troll like and rude, But the community and people in the game, should hang in there and try to help eachother out for there experiences to be better.Elves and giants. Now about both sides.  The players can have alot of racism between the two. Elves and Giants i admit they barely. Even Get anything good. Humans Practically get everything. Elves need Better archer skills. Also A melee talent and better magic for themselfs. Giants. I think should be able to duel wield all one handed melee weapons, not just swords and blunts. Idk why but you cant duel wield blunts as human same with axes, But with swords you can. Im not sure if you can with giants though. But im kinda doubting it. Humans also get alot of towns to themselfs, where as elves and giants just get one. Uladh could use some real good field bosses to though. Tory ravine, hasn't been unlocked yet. I kind of like how they changed the dungeons. The rewards and stuff to. The event's are mostly Afk events so you can make alot of gold selling the stuff from those. Some of the event's can be fun to. The Premium Service and VIP Service are outdated. Only good for housing.The thing is though, The game  currently Makes me feel like You have to pay to do something good, and worth doing. It's currently Building up more and more. But not into something worth doing. Like sure its free to play, but it  does feel like it's turning into a really bad free to pay, to regret it afterwards aswell. So that's it. That's my review It's really upto you and your preferances for your likings to the game.If anyone needs help with the game just note me ingame. Sorry for my bad grammar though.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
												Hadn't been playing any MMOs in a while and then I found this. I would only recommend this game to those to has the time  to play this game. Mabinogi has varieties of systems and endless gameplay depending on what kind of player you are. But If you're a new player who wants to get into PVP right away you'll never be able to compete with players that has been in the server for years. Players that's been in for years are basically gods when it comes to pvp. Just don't bother trying to be the top PVP-er.Been playing for at least 2 weeks and i'll just list the pros and cons.Pros:-Fun-Various of systems ingame that'll keep you busy-Friendly players who are willing to help you and teach you (So far i haven't met a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥-Complex systems but at the same time once you get the hang of it you'll realize that its awesome.-Admirable and adorable stuff in it. If you like anime and dressing up your character in various ways this game is for you.Con:-Some stuff you have to actually use cash like pets. But you can get them through hard work which takes awhile if you have no time to grind.-This game is a grind fest. To get strong or craft better things you have to grind for it. In layman's term grinding is basically training to get more experience for your character. This game is the so time consuming and addictive once you get into it that it'll consume your soul and you'll be like FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUk . . . there goes another day . . . . .-Exploration experience is a B***H to obtain. Its one of the things I hate in the game cause you have to actually take hours of your time to grind for Exploration experience just to level your exploration level so that you can get your AP.All in all its a fun game. Just remember your the player. You're in control of the game not the other way around. Don't be played by the game fam . . .

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												Okay, so. Having heard about this game, and seeing the mostly positive reviews, I decided to attempt to play it. However, once I managed to navigate the start up menu and create a character (and even that was a chore), I was just plopped in the world, with very little explination of what to do, no money and no weapon. I proceeded to wander around aimlessly until I got killed by a giant spider because I didn't know how to attack. Eventually, I managed to get a slim understanding of what I had to do. However, even so, the controls were so horrendus that I had a very hard time enjoying this game. In conclusion:Pros:-Amazing premise-Cute characters-Good storytelling-Player choiceCons:-Terrible controls-Hard to play-No guidance-The usual 'free-to-play-except-if-you-want-to-suceed-you-need-to-buy-things'

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												When one first enters into Mabinogi, it will seem like a simple MMORPG.But it's not, it's like calling TF2 a simple FPS.What makes this game unique is how it gives so many approaches and how immersive it is.You can be a chef that smashes things with a hammer, or a puppeteer who fights by controlling puppets twice your size. And unlike most MMORPGs which take to grinding to make any money or levels, Mabinogi uses an intriguing and original way to avoid this droning method of advancement.While there is indeed content that requires real money that adds on to the experience. Playing it free by itself is still worthwhile and satiating for the gaming palette, especially if you enjoy immersion.
